Definition: Formation of deposits (fouling) with the participation of microorganisms

Name: Formverfahren
Definition: Process for producing the casting molds for holding the liquid metal

Name: Gasinjektionstechnik
Definition: Special injection molding process, targeted injection of inert gas into a mold partially filled with polymer melt, production of molded parts that have a cavity inside.

Name: Bakelite
Definition: Trademark for phenoplastics of Bakelite-GmbH

Name: Bruchtrennen
Definition: Processing technique for separating highly viscous masses such as molten glass, polymer melts and viscous foodstuffs.

Name: Hydroprillen
Definition: Formation of uniform solid particles from melts in an inert cooling liquid

Name: Chemikant
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Verfahrenstechniker
Definition: Before assigning as HZ for personal keywords, please check whether it is actually a technician or an engineer.

Name: Envelope layer
Definition: Used for process and energy technology

Name: Hinterspritzen
Definition: Special injection molding process for producing decorated molded parts. A three-layer decorative material is inserted between the two halves of the injection mold. During injection, the plastic melt bonds with the decorative material.

Name: Hydrodemetallisierung
Definition: Removal of metals, e.g. during crude oil processing

Name: Verkapselung
Definition: Used for the encapsulation of chem. substances, e.g. pharmaceuticals

Name: Peeling aisle
Definition: Term from milling technology

Name: Kaltkanalverteiler
Definition: Distributor system for mold filling during injection molding

Name: Reinigungsverfahren
Definition: Processes for the extraction and purification of chem. substances

Name: Konversionsverfahren
Definition: Conversion of higher boiling distillates and residues into gasoline, etc.

Name: Alkalization Textile technology
Definition: Pretreatment process for polyester fibers to achieve a silk-like sheen and handle through the action of alkalis.

Name: Emergency cooling
Definition: Can be used not only for nuclear reactors but also for chemical reactors

Name: Fettabscheider
Definition: Waste water purification device for fats

Name: Resolepoxidharz
Definition: Epoxy resins with Resol type binders

Name: Endlosfaser
Definition: also used for continuous glass and ceramic fibers

Name: Teilchentechnologie
Definition: Production, transportation and processing of small particles

Name: Nebenstromfilter
Definition: High-performance filters, e.g. for motor vehicles

Name: Autogenous grinding
Definition: Grinding process in which coarse particles of the material to be crushed are used as grinding media.

Name: Holzessig
Definition: Acetic acid produced by wood distillation

Name: Process mechanic for plastics and rubber technology
Definition: Training occupation assigned to the occupational field of metal technology, specializing in production and machining technology (Beruf aktuell 2007).

Name: Vulkanfiber
Definition: Laminated stock, produced by parchmenting unsized papers, according to DIN 7737

Name: Ultraform
Definition: Thermoplastic acetal copolymer molding compounds for injection molding and extrusion, produced by copolymerization of trioxane with small amounts of copolymers

Name: Palusol
Definition: Fire protection board made of aqueous sodium silicate, glass fibers and a wire mesh insert on wood, metal or glass

Name: Styrodur
Definition: Styrodur is the brand name for extruded polystyrene from the company BASF (color green).

Name: Styrolux
Definition: Thermoplastic material based on a styrene/butadiene block polymer

Name: Radialstromreaktor
Definition: Tubular fixed-bed reactor with radial flow

Name: Particle size
Definition: Particle size in powders, dusts and granular mixtures such as sediments, soils and building materials

Name: Rotationsscherfilter
Definition: Membrane filter with moving membranes

Name: Veraschen
Definition: Oxidative destruction of organ. Substance (cellulose, sugar, protein, coal, leather, plastics, etc.) by heating in the presence of air until only the incombustible mineral ash remains. Ash remains.

Name: Hochdruckwassernebel
Definition: Deletion procedure

Name: PE 100
Definition: Pipe material made of bimodal polyethylene produced using the Ziegler process. The number 100 refers to the performance class or creep strength.

Name: Compoundierverfahren
Definition: Process in which plastics are provided with additives and simultaneously converted into a processable form.

Name: Amalgamverfahren
Definition: Chlor-alkali electrolysis process

Name: Treibsatz
Definition: Pyrotechnic mixture of substances which, when burning, propels rockets etc., or whose combustion pressure is used to trigger safety devices such as airbags etc. and accelerate projectiles

Name: Plantaren
Definition: Brand name of a phosphate-free surfactant from Henkel

Name: Filmscharnier
Definition: Plastic film hinges are integrated flexible connections between two areas of an injection-molded part that allow them to move relative to each other.

Name: Free-fall atomizer
Definition: The melt first travels a distance of free fall in the direction of gravitational acceleration after leaving the distributor before it is atomized by the gas jets.

Name: Pyrolysekoks
Definition: Coke produced by pyrolysis of carbonaceous materials

Name: Rohrbegleitheizung
Definition: Electrical heating that keeps substances transported in pipes at certain temperatures in process engineering

Name: Schmelzkerntechnik
Definition: Special process of injection molding of plastics for the production of molded parts with complex internal geometry or undercuts. A core made of a low-melting metal alloy is overmolded. After the plastic has cooled, it is removed from the injection mold and the melt core is then melted out of the plastic component.

Name: Membranreaktor
Definition: Generally for chemical reactors, as OB for membrane bioreactor

Name: Spiral jet mill
Definition: Jet mill with flat swirl flow around the vertical axis, with airlift zone towards the center with centric outlet opening

Name: Moschusduftstoff
Definition: Synthetically produced fragrance with a similar odor to the glandular secretion of the musk deer

Name: Entbinderung
Definition: Complete removal of the organic additives from the green body, as they can otherwise hinder sintering or lead to changes in the properties of the ceramic components. Debinding is carried out e.g. by wet extraction or thermal decomposition.

Name: Cyclone B
Definition: Original trade name for highly effective hydrogen cyanide-containing fumigants for pest control, used in World War II as a code name for hydrogen cyanide for mass killing in the NS extermination camps

Name: Nitrox
Definition: Gas mixture of nitrogen and oxygen used for diving with an increased oxygen content (usually 32% or 36%)

Name: Injection stamping
Definition: Special injection molding process, combination of injection molding and pressing processes

Name: Lichtbleichen
Definition: Especially bleaching in an alkaline solution using daylight lamps for restoration

Name: Kautschuktechniker
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Kunststofftechniker
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Cold spraying
Definition: Sprayed liquid droplets are solidified into powder in a cold gas stream via a phase transformation. The product is a powder with the same composition of ingredients as the original liquid.

Name: Parametric pumping
Definition: Cyclic ion exchange process for the separation of liquid mixtures or multi-component solutions

Name: Simulated counter-current chromatography
Definition: Chromatography process with periodic operation control. The counterflow is imitated by valve switching of four external flows after a time interval.

Name: Holzverzuckerung
Definition: Chemical processing of wood (waste)

Name: End of the Pipe-Technik
Definition: Chemical processes for environmental protection

Name: Trockenabscheidung
Definition: Coating technology processes

Name: Cat-CVD-Verfahren
Definition: CVD process based on a catalyzed reaction

Name: Planrost
Definition: Resting grate

Name: Grate firing
Definition: Consists of iron bars, through the gaps between which air flows past the burning pieces of coal

Name: Inclined grate
Definition: Coal is transported by alternately upward and downward moving grate bars.

Name: Treppenrost
Definition: Coal is moved by its own weight

Name: Walzenrost
Definition: Layers of fuel are repeatedly turned between the rollers and brought into contact with the already ignited fuel.

Name: Sepia pigment
Definition: Brown to gray-black pigment from the dried secretion of the squid.

Name: Art mill
Definition: New type of mill since the 19th century, characterized by technical innovations, widespread in southern Germany

Name: ChemSep
Definition: Computer program for distillation simulation

Name: Reactive extrusion
Definition: Process for the synthesis and modification of polymers

Name: Kollergang
Definition: Crushing machine; several heavy rollers rotating around a horizontal shaft and revolving around a vertical shaft crush the material between them and the stationary grinding track.

Name: Acella
Definition: Plastic film made from polyvinyl chloride

Name: Harzinfusionsverfahren
Definition: Process for the production of fiber-reinforced plastic components by wet impregnation with the application of a vacuum

Name: Microtiter plate
Definition: A microtiter plate is a laboratory device for investigating biological properties, for example for measuring absorbance in photometers or for high-throughput screening (HTS, high-throughput testing) in pharmaceutical and crop protection research.

Name: Cordit
Definition: Smokeless gunpowder made from nitroglycerine, guncotton and Vaseline

Name: Hot runner sprue
Definition: Separately heated distribution channel for plastic melt

Name: Wasservorhang
Definition: is used to create water curtains to prevent the spread of heavy gases in the event of incidents

Name: HCCI
Definition: Ignition process for engines. Controlled auto-ignition is a hybrid of conventional homogeneous combustion and compression ignition. As in diesel engines, the fuel is exposed to a high temperature, which causes it to ignite. However, the fuel is not injected as in a diesel engine, but a homogeneous fuel-air mixture is generated during the intake phase.

Name: LEPECVD process
Definition: Newly developed low-energy, plasma-assisted chemical vapor deposition process

Name: Vistra rayon
Definition: The world's first rayon, developed in Premnitz in 1919

Name: Funktionskunststoff
Definition: Special plastic for just one application

Name: Elektrospinnen
Definition: Process for the production of polymer nanofibers and nanotubes

Name: Moplen
Definition: Thermoplastic, trademark of a group of copolymers from the manufacturer Basell

Name: Wabenkerze
Definition: A honeycomb candle consists of hand-rolled beeswax honeycombs.

Name: Soot distillery
Definition: Production of carbon black for paint production and printing

Name: Gerstenstampfe
Definition: Tamping device to hull the barley

Name: Vinnol
Definition: Copolymers containing vinyl chloride, in particular in the form of solution and dispersion

Name: Blue color mill
Definition: Mill for grinding cobalt

Name: Wirbelabscheider
Definition: Used to separate settling solids from stormwater runoff according to the principle of sedimentation.

Name: Grudekoks
Definition: Backlog in lignite smouldering

Name: Tapelegen
Definition: Thermoplastic tape laying technology is a new processing technique that is still under development and allows unidirectional, fiber-reinforced semi-finished products to be automatically deposited on flat or curved tools with variable positions and orientations.

Name: Light oil
Definition: Mineral oil products in which a proportion of more than 90 % has evaporated in the boiling analysis at a temperature of 210 C

Name: Bois Durci
Definition: Artificial wood, mainly used in France between 1855 and 1927

Name: Synthetische Biologie
Definition: Specialist field at the interface of nanobiotechnology, organic chemistry, engineering, molecular biology and information technology with the aim of creating biological systems that do not occur in nature and have new useful properties. This ranges from individual molecules such as amino acids to new microorganisms.

Name: Chemikantin
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Membrane process engineering
Definition: Can be linked to SW Semipermeable membrane (both biol. and techn.) or similar.

Name: Lebendharzung
Definition: Resination of living trees. In the Alpine region, especially Austria, the term "Pecherei" is used. It is not about the extraction of pitch as a substance, "pitch" here stands for tree resin.

Name: Köhler profession
Definition: Almost extinct craft trade for the production of charcoal

Name: Perfumer
Definition: Profession for the creation of perfume; no training occupation in Germany

Name: Parfümeurin
Definition: Beruf zur Kreation von Parfüm; kein Ausbildungsberuf in Deutschland

Name: Eutektoid
Definition: A crystalline mixture (structure) of two or more substances that forms from a solid solution (phase) of mixed crystals of these substances as a result of transformation into two or more other types of crystals (phases) when the temperature falls below a certain level.

Name: Ripolin
Definition: Registered brand name for the lacquer paint invented by Carl Julius Ferdinand Riep in 1888; Riep took the formula to France in 1897; the brand is now owned by PPG Industries, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

Name: Ballistit
Definition: Historically the first smokeless powder based on glycerol trinitrate (nitroglycerin), patented by Nobel in 1888

Name: Projektilinjektionstechnik
Definition: Special injection molding process for the production of injection-molded hollow parts. Cavities are formed by propelling a rigid projectile through the molten areas of the component using a propelling fluid.

Name: HPV chemical
Definition: Chemicals, of which more than 1000 tons are produced annually

Name: Wollin fabrics, textiles
Definition: Artificial word for a wool-like fabric made of cotton backing and acetate artificial silk

Name: Thiol-ene click chemistry
Definition: The radical-supported thiol-ene reaction is a special reaction of click chemistry.

Name: Alpecin brand
Definition: Brand name for a range of caffeinated shampoos

Name: Nitrogen elimination
Definition: Entfernung von Phosphat aus Abwasser

Name: Biorohstoff
Definition: Raw material from renewable resources

Name: Montanwachs
Definition: Is a natural wax that can be extracted from some types of lignite.

Name: Diesel R33
Definition: Diesel fuel that consists of 33 percent biogenic raw materials (26 percent hydrogenated vegetable oil (HVO), 7 percent used cooking oil methyl ester, 67 percent high-quality diesel fuel).

Name: Debonding
Definition: Debonding occurs when an adhesive stops sticking (adhering) to an adherend or substrate material.

Name: Flash atomization
Definition: Atomization of superheated fluids

Name: Multi-component injection molding
Definition: Multi-component injection molding is used to produce injection-moulded parts that consist of two or more different plastics. In the simplest case, the plastics only differ in color in order to achieve a certain design. However, different materials and therefore different properties can also be specifically combined.

Name: Hohlglasfaser
Definition: Glass fibers with a hollow cross-section

Name: Radiation crosslinking plastic
Definition: Plastic refinement by irradiation, e.g. with high-energy electron or gamma radiation

Name: Organoblech
Definition: Organosheets are semi-finished fiber-matrix products. They consist of a fiber fabric or a fiber scrim embedded in a thermoplastic matrix.

Name: Pigment preparation
Definition: Highly concentrated form of pigments for coloring varnishes and paints

Name: Oil tank
Definition: Used for oil storage tanks of all sizes

Name: Fiber pushout test
Definition: The fiber pushout test is a fracture mechanics test method for fiber composites to determine the fiber-matrix adhesion. The fiber is pushed out of the composite material and the energy dissipation during the detachment of the fiber from the matrix along the interface as well as the dissipation of energy in plastic deformation of the surrounding matrix is taken into account.

Name: Metagenomik
Definition: Discipline of biotechnology, deals with the analysis of metagenomes, i.e. the entirety of the genetic material of (micro)organisms of a site, in particular for the identification of previously unknown natural substances

Name: Partikelmechanik
Definition: Particle mechanics deals with the modeling and simulation of systems consisting of particles and particle processes.

Name: Pechofen
Definition: Plant for the production of wood tar and wood vinegar, which are produced during the carbonization of resinous wood.

Name: Towpreg
Definition: Towpreg is a carbon fiber pre-impregnated with resin, a derivative of prepreg, which is wound onto a spool.   The deposition process takes place after the towpreg has been clamped in the creel of the production line directly into the deposition mold. The material is trimmed in this mold and cured in an autoclave.

Name: Hypergol
Definition: Hypergol is a rocket propellant whose components react spontaneously with each other when they are brought into contact or mixed. The term hypergol was coined by the German Wolfgang Carl Nöggerath, who first used this term for self-igniting propellant mixtures such as those used in the Me 163B.

Name: Styrofoam
Definition: Styrofoam is a trademark for extruded polystyrene (polystyrene foam) from Dow Chemical.

Name: Geofoam
Definition: Geofoam is extruded polystyrene or exoandable polystyrene manufactured in large lightweight blocks.

Name: Sanitisierung
Definition: In the pharmaceutical sector, a special cleaning and disinfection process to significantly reduce the bacterial count (usually by 1-2 powers of ten).

Name: Hydrothermal carbonization
Definition: Chemical process for the simple production of lignite substitute, synthesis gas, liquid petroleum precursors and humus from biomass with the release of energy and water.

Name: Tide mill
Definition: Periodically driven by the ebb and flow of the tide; from the early Middle Ages, mills were mainly built on coasts with sufficient tidal range

Name: 3-Methyl-3-buten-1-ol
Definition: Isopentenyl alcohol is a primary alcohol having the structure of isopentyl alcohol but with a double bond between C-3 and one of the C-4 atoms. It has a role as a metabolite. It is a primary alcohol and a homoallylic alcohol. 3-Methyl-3-buten-1-OL is a natural product found in Cananga odorata, Bistorta manshuriensis, and other organisms with data available.

Name: Elastomer
Definition: Elastomers are dimensionally stable but elastically deformable plastics whose glass transition point is below the application temperature. The plastics can deform elastically under tensile and compressive load, but then return to their original, undeformed shape.

Name: Ferrite
Definition: used for sintering material, for iron modification ben. SW iron <alpha->

Name: Hochtemperaturwerkstoff
Definition: Materials for applications above 1500 degrees Celsius.

Name: Reibung
Definition: Friction, also known as frictional resistance, is a force that acts between bodies or particles that are in contact with each other.

Name: Tribologie
Definition: Tribology (friction science) deals with the scientific description of friction, the calculation and measurement of friction coefficients, wear and the necessary lubrication between interacting surfaces in relative motion.

Name: Heat-resistant steel
Definition: Steel with good strength properties up to 600 degrees C.

Name: Werkstoff
Definition: Materials are materials from which workpieces are made.

Name: Material fatigue
Definition: Material damage due to periodically changing mechanical and/or thermal loads

Name: Bruchmechanik
Definition: Fracture mechanics deals with the failure of cracked components or the propagation of cracks under static and dynamic loads until fracture. It includes elements of materials science, elastostatics and plastomechanics.

Name: Dendrit
Definition: for biological facts see dendrite<histology>

Name: Alterung
Definition: Change in material properties over time

Name: Guinier-Preston zone
Definition: Areas created in metal alloys by segregation processes

Name: Heat-resistant steel
Definition: Steel with increased scale resistance above 550 degrees C.

Name: High temperature steel
Definition: Good strength properties up to 800 degrees Celsius

Name: Kriechfestigkeit
Definition: Variable time and temperature

Name: Metallschmelze
Definition: The liquid state occurs at any temperature (especially at higher temperatures)

Name: Wear test
Definition: Investigation of the material behavior under wear stress

Name: Zeitstandfestigkeit
Definition: Variable time, constant temperature

Name: Maraging steel
Definition: High-alloy NiCoMo steel

Name: Ceramic-metal composite
Definition: Used for technical purposes only

Name: Zugscherversuch
Definition: Material testing methods

Name: Granulärer Stoff
Definition: Accumulation of solid, distinguishable particles, e.g. sand, gravel, powder or rice or flour just like the rings of Saturn, for example.

Name: Teilchenverbundwerkstoff
Definition: Are composite materials in whose matrices particles of other elements are embedded.

Name: Intelligenter Werkstoff
Definition: New materials that are able to react to external stimuli and thus prevent or repair damage (self-diagnosis, partly through integrated sensors) or isolate the damaged part in such a way that the overall functionality is maintained. Materials with sensory or actuator capabilities.

Name: ODS-Superalloy
Definition: ODS = Oxide dispersion strenghtened

Name: Werkstoffschädigung
Definition: Not only for damage caused by vibration stress

Name: Recreation metallurgy
Definition: Approximation of the physical properties of the material to its properties prior to deformation, e.g. also through relaxation of residual stresses. On the one hand, vacancies and dislocations of opposite sign are annihilated and, on the other hand, dislocations of the same sign are rearranged into a more energetically favourable position (polygonization).

Name: Hochleistungswerkstoff
Definition: Customized materials with specific desired properties achieved through targeted synthesis

Name: Randschicht
Definition: Further defined, not only for semiconductor layers

Name: Corinthian bronze
Definition: Bronze with gold and silver additions

Name: Ormocer
Definition: New material made of organic/inorganic hybrid material hybrid material

Name: Schichtwerkstoff
Definition: Used for technically usable materials

Name: Umschmelzlegieren
Definition: Change in composition through melting of the components. If this process is limited to the surface, it is referred to as surface alloying.

Name: Adolf Martens Prize
Definition: Prize for the promotion of materials science

Name: Nitinol
Definition: Special nickel-titanium alloy with 55 % Ni and so-called shape memory

Name: Hochleistungskeramik
Definition: Ceramic materials for use under high mechanical and/or thermal stress

Name: Zwischenfaserbruch
Definition: An intermediate fiber fracture occurs when the fracture surface of a fiber composite runs parallel to the fiber direction through the matrix and / or along the fiber / matrix interface

Name: Udimet 700
Definition: Nickelbasislegierung

Name: Functional gradient material
Definition: Material whose composition or structure changes gradually or continuously from the interior of the volume to the surface

Name: Crack closing
Definition: is based on a reduction in the effective amplitude of the stress intensity arriving at the crack tip and thus on a slowing down of the crack propagation. Possible causes: plasticity, roughness and formation of oxides

Name: Duplication of materials science
Definition: Material defect caused by blowholes when rolling metallic materials

Name: Lagerstahl
Definition: Steels used for running and sliding surfaces in bearings

Name: Kurzriss
Definition: Short crack

Name: Near alpha alloy
Definition: Microstructure with mainly hexagonal close-packed alpha phase and a small proportion of body-centered cubic beta phase

Name: Monel
Definition: Alloy of nickel and copper

Name: Eindringverfahren
Definition: Not to be confused with indentation hardness testing

Name: Stanniol
Definition: Thin foil made of tin, used as a packaging material for tinsel, etc., today mostly replaced by aluminum foil

Name: Pakfeng
Definition: Copper-nickel-zinc alloy, invented in China

Name: Partial melting
Definition: Imperfect melt, e.g. from rocks

Name: Ultra high-strength steel
Definition: Steel grades characterized by strengths of up to 2100 N/mm2

Name: Alloy 800
Definition: Austenitic Fe-Ni-Cr steel, which is produced in various compositions

Name: Konstruktionswerkstoff
Definition: Construction materials have material properties such as toughness or wear resistance that are suitable for constructions in mechanical and plant engineering.

Name: Rotation capability
Definition: Material property e.g. of reinforced concrete (deformation reserve)

Name: Import material
Definition: Case of non-failure of materials in which, despite initial plastic deformation, the plastic strain increases subside until finally no further plasticization can be observed. The material then behaves purely elastically.

Name: Alleskleber
Definition: Adhesives that can be used to bond many things, but not everything

Name: Materialcharakterisierung
Definition: Description of internal and external material properties using analytical methods such as spectroscopy, microscopy, chromatography

Name: Nordic Gold
Definition: Copper-based alloy with the additional alloying elements aluminum, zinc and tin; material for the production of 10, 20 and 50 cent coins of the euro currency

Name: TRIP-Steel
Definition: TRIP = acronym for Transformation Induced Plasticity; TRIP steel = further development of dual-phase steel

Name: Splinter fracture Material
Definition: Formation and growth of many fractures in a certain area of a material at the same time.

Name: Bruchspannung
Definition: Highest achievable stress of a solid before it breaks

Name: Creasing capability
Definition: Important quality feature of cardboard

Name: Electron material
Definition: Group of magnesium alloys, also trademarks

Name: Funktionswerkstoff
Definition: Functional materials are named according to their intended use, e.g. dental material, high-temperature material, structural material

Name: Combinatorial materials research
Definition: Use of combinatorial methods to discover and optimize new materials

Name: Blitzradiographie
Definition: Flash radiography is used to record high-speed events in the nanosecond range.

Name: Ratcheting
Definition: The term ratcheting refers to a unidirectional increase in plastic deformation under cyclic loading conditions. The phenomenon of ratcheting is also known as failure due to unidirectional stepwise deformation and cyclic strain accumulation.

Name: TWIP-Steel
Definition: TWIP = acronym for Twinning Induced Plasticity; TWIP steel = further development of dual-phase steel

Name: Schmiedeeisen
Definition: Wrought iron is the iron with the lowest carbon content (0.05-0.6 %) of the three main types of iron, alongside raw or cast iron and steel

Name: Reaktionslot
Definition: Solders in which alloying elements are introduced via a chemical reaction during the soldering process. This doping occurs through the interaction of a base alloy with an organometallic compound.

Name: Wood-plastic composite
Definition: WPC are thermoplastically processable composite materials made from different proportions of wood - typically wood flour - plastics and additives.

Name: Cement-bonded material
Definition: Composite material with cement as a binder

Name: Bulge test
Definition: Method for investigating the mechanical properties of thin films.

Name: Werkstoffmechanik
Definition: Is the quantitative description of the mechanical behavior of a material using the methods of solid mechanics (continuum mechanics), taking into account the findings of solid state physics and materials science.

Name: Electrorheological fluid
Definition: Electrorheological liquids, or electrorheological fluids, are adaptive materials whose flow behavior can be controlled quickly and reversibly over a wide range by an electric field.

Name: Structural Health Monitoring
Definition: SHM is the continuous or periodic and automated method for determining and monitoring the condition of a monitored object within condition monitoring. The aim is to detect damage, for example cracks or deformations, at an early stage in order to initiate countermeasures.

Name: Chaboche model
Definition: Viscoplastic material model

Name: ICME
Definition: ICME is the computer-aided combination of material development, product development and manufacturing processes with the aim of achieving the best possible component performance, efficient development processes and economical manufacturing processes. The focus is on material behavior.

Name: Materialmodellierung
Definition: Simulative methods based on theoretical solid state physics and material mechanics are used to clarify material behavior and predict material properties.

Name: Ramberg-Osgood equation
Definition: The Ramberg-Osgood equation describes the non-linear relationship between stresses and strains in the stress-strain curve immediately around the yield point.

Name: Bioverbundwerkstoff
Definition: Composite materials with a biogenic component, e.g. the matrix material is a resin such as a polymer or biopolymer and the reinforcement is a natural fiber such as hemp.

Name: Hyperelasticity
Definition: Is a material model of elasticity for materials such as rubber and biological tissue. Is a special case of Cauchy elasticity

Name: Cauchy-Elastizität
Definition: Is a material model of elasticity and is a time-independent material property.

Name: Hooke's law
Definition: Hooke's law (according to Robert Hooke) describes the elastic deformation of solids when their deformation is proportional to the applied load (linear-elastic behavior)

Name: Neo-Hooke model
Definition: Solid model of hyperelasticity, special case of the Mooney-Rivlin model.  Generalizes Hooke's law in a suitable way to large deformations.

Name: Mooney-Rivlin-Modell
Definition: Solid model of hyperelasticity.

Name: Arruda-Boyce model
Definition: Is a hyperelastic constitutive model used to describe the mechanical behavior of rubber and other polymeric substances.

Name: Mullins effect
Definition: Is the load-induced softening of rubber materials under static load.

Name: Payne effect
Definition: This is the load-induced softening of rubber materials under dynamic stress. Changes in the properties of an elastomer component depending on the dynamic load applied.

Name: Whisker-reinforced metal
Definition: Is a metal matrix composite material, whereby the metal alloy is reinforced by whiskers (hair, fiber, needle crystals)

Name: Hochentropielegierung
Definition: High-entropy alloy consists of no less than five different metals in equal proportions: cobalt, chromium, iron, manganese and nickel

Name: ZTA-Chart
Definition: The diagram shows the heating rate and temperature at which a homogeneous austenite of a certain grain size is achieved.

Name: Metallspritzguss
Definition: Metal injection molding is a primary molding process for the production of metallic components with complex geometries and has its origins in plastic injection molding technology.

Name: Finite strain theory
Definition: Finite strain theory deals with deformations in which both rotations and strains are arbitrarily large, i.e. invalidates the assumptions inherent in infinitesimal strain theory. This is commonly the case with elastomers, plastically-deforming materials and other fluids and biological soft tissue.

Name: Finite deformation theory
Definition: Finite deformation theory is proposed that can describe precisely, the nonlinear geometric behavior of a structure.

Name: Tribosystem
Definition: The tribological system refers to a system consisting of a base body, counter body and intermediate materials. Friction and wear are investigated as a function of the materials and lubricants and taking into account the interactions between the acting forces, speeds and environmental influences, such as temperature, humidity, etc.

Name: Metal dusting
Definition: Is an extreme form of corrosion that occurs when sensitive metallic materials are exposed to environments with extremely high carbon contents. Carbon deposition takes place on the surface (coke, soot). As a result, the metallic component disintegrates into dust consisting of graphite and metal or metal carbide particles. Carburization can take place in a range of industrial combustion or gasification atmospheres.

Name: Newkirk effect
Definition: The Newkirk effect describes the change in vibration of a rotor as a result of its thermal expansion due to friction on the stationary components.

Name: Cellular metallic material
Definition: Cellular metallic materials are a class of materials characterized by a high overall porosity with pore sizes of up to approx. 10 mm.

Name: Lattice material
Definition: A lattice material is defined as a material whose material structure in the mesometer range (0.01m) is made up of a spatial, periodic network of bar support structures and/or sheet support structures, such as bars, beams and plates, shells. The material structure or lattice structure is defined by a directionally oriented unit cell, which itself is to be understood as an interlocking network consisting of these load-bearing structures. As the mechanical, elastodynamic and acoustic properties are determined by the architecture of the unit cell of the lattice material, materials can be tailored to the respective industrial application as a lattice material, which is not always possible with conventional materials.

Name: Dielectric elastomer
Definition: Dielectric elastomers are adaptive material systems that can generate high elongations (up to 300 %). They belong to the group of electroactive polymers (EAP).

Name: Hohlkugelstruktur
Definition: Hollow sphere structures are a subgroup of cellular materials. The structures consist of spherical cells with a narrow diameter distribution. A distinction is made between metallic and ceramic hollow sphere structures.

Name: Johnson-Cook model
Definition: The Johnson-Cook model is an empirical model for calculating the yield stress in the theory of plasticity.

Name: Ohno-Wang model
Definition: Elastoplastic material model, particularly suitable for the simulation of ratcheting.

Name: Nakajima attempt
Definition: The Nakajima test is based on a deep-drawing test. By loading a clamped specimen with a hemispherical punch, a multiaxial load condition can be generated. Suitable specimen geometries can also be used to achieve comparability with the equibiaxial and uniaxial tensile tests.

Name: Marciniak-Versuch
Definition: The Marciniak test is based on a deep-drawing test. By loading a clamped specimen with a cylindrical punch, a multiaxial load condition can be generated.  While a hemispherical punch is used in the Nakajima test, the drawing punch in the Marciniak test is cylindrical.

Name: Erichsen experiment
Definition: There are special testing machines for the Erichsen cupping test, in which the sheet metal to be tested is inserted and held on the die by a holding-down force. A hardened ball with a diameter of around 20 mm then presses against the sheet metal from below, causing a cold deformation.

Name: Self-healing material
Definition: Self-healing materials are artificial or synthetically produced substances with the built-in ability to automatically repair themselves without external problem diagnosis or human interaction.

Name: Kerbfestigkeit
Definition: Notch resistance, also known as tear propagation resistance, is the property of a fabric not to tear further even in the presence of a notch.

Name: Kerbwirkungszahl
Definition: The notch coefficient is defined as the quotient of the shape number and the support number.

Name: Kerbformzahl
Definition: The form number sets the highest voltage present in the notch in relation to the nominal voltage

Name: Mindlin-Reissner plate theory
Definition: The Mindlin-Reissner plate theory is an extension of the Kirchhoff-Love plate theory and takes into account the dependence of the shear deformation on the plate thickness.

Name: Kirchhoff-Love plate theory
Definition: The Kirchhoff-Love plate theory is an extension of the Euler-Bernoulli beam theory and is a two-dimensional mathematical model for determining the stresses and strains in thin plates under mechanical loading by forces and moments.

Name: Dauerhaftigkeit
Definition: Durability in the narrower sense refers to the resistance of materials, building materials and building components to external influences such as moisture penetration, alternating humidity, heat and cold, temperature changes and frost, solar radiation (UV light), chemical attack (acid rain, de-icing salt, saltpetre) and pest and fungal infestation in the case of organic materials.

Name: Potin
Definition: Alloy of copper, tin, lead and antimony

Name: Elektrum
Definition: Gold and silver alloy

Name: Sondermessing
Definition: Copper-zinc alloys to which other alloying elements are added (usually manganese, aluminum, silicon, iron, tin or nickel)

Name: Ecobrass
Definition: Lead-free special brass with good corrosion resistance and very good machinability; alloy of 76% copper, 21% zinc and 3% silicon

Name: Blattmetall
Definition: very thinly rolled and beaten metals or metal alloys, especially gold alloys

Name: Nanokohlenstoff
Definition: A carbon-based material whose constituents are of nanoscale dimensions, or which is produced by nanotechnology.

Name: Hard carbon
Definition: Hard carbon is a solid form of carbon that cannot be converted into graphite by heat treatment.

Name: Mesopore
Definition: Pore with a diameter of 2 to 50 nanometers.

Name: MAX Phase
Definition: The MAX phases are layered, hexagonal carbides and nitrides which have the general formula: M(n+1)AXn, (MAX) where n = 1 to 4, and M is an early transition metal, A is an A-group (mostly IIIA and IVA, or groups 13 and 14) element and X is either carbon and/or nitrogen.

Name: Transferfilm
Definition: "An elementary process of sliding is the formation of so-called transfer ﬁlms, which involve the (mutual) deposition of separated material on the sliding surface of the other sliding partner."

Name: Energetic structural material
Definition: Energetic structural materials have characteristics of both the structural strength and the energy release as energetic composite materials.

Name: German Mill Day
Definition: Since 1994, a nationwide event on Whit Monday, on which several 100 mills invite visitors to take a tour etc.

Name: Hektograph
Definition: Apparatus for reproducing documents and drawings in which the original, written in aniline ink, is transferred to a gelatine-coated printing plate from which a large number of prints can be made.

Name: Wasserkran
Definition: Crane-shaped water extraction point for steam locomotives

Name: Maschinenbuch
Definition: A pictorial genre of technical literature from the late 16th to early 18th century.

Name: Gewerke
Definition: Historically a shareholder in a mining company and companies in related industries

Name: Langley Aerodrome
Definition: Hist. aircraft with tandem wings, manned and unmanned tested 1894-1914

Name: Bionik
Definition: Bionics refers to research and development approaches that pursue a technical application interest and, in the search for solutions to problems, inventions and innovations, draw on knowledge from the analysis of living systems and transfer this knowledge to technical systems. The idea of transferring knowledge from biology to technology is the central element of bionics.

Name: Fachzeichnen
Definition: Ben.for the subject in skilled worker training

Name: Ingenieur
Definition: Used differently as a professional title in Germany and Austria

Name: Instandsetzung
Definition: For the repair of signs of wear

Name: Oberfläche
Definition: Used for interfaces between condensed matter, i.e. liquids and solids on the one hand and gases or vacuum on the other hand

Name: Technical draftsman
Definition: Training occupation; new job title from 01.08.2011: Technical system planner

Name: Technisches Zeichnen
Definition: Preparation of exact, true-to-scale drawings of technical objects or constructions as a template for production

Name: Technologie
Definition: Processes for the extraction and treatment or processing of materials or workpieces into technical products; as USW not permuting to individual subject areas; e.g. ceramics / technology

Name: Technologietransfer
Definition: Private-sector or state-supported process of diffusion or dissemination of technology for economic utilization by third parties, including developing or emerging countries

Name: Reparatur
Definition: During a repair, faulty parts of a defective appliance are replaced.

Name: Rules of technology
Definition: only for secondary literature

Name: Verbindungstechnik
Definition: Term defined more broadly than in B 1986, as used in the VDI Mechanical Engineering Dictionary for electrical, electronic, mechanical and optical connection processes.

Name: Altstoff
Definition: Generic term for waste oil, waste glass, etc.

Name: Technische Zeichnung
Definition: Non-moving image consisting of a cross-section, detail, diagram, elevation, view, plan, working plan, etc., made for use in a technical or other specialized context (RDA AH-007).

Name: Ingenieurwissenschaften
Definition: The entirety of the disciplines that arose from the systematic theoretical treatment of technical problems and are the subject of engineering studies today.

Name: Dynamic behavior
Definition: Reaction to dynamic forces introduced from outside, e.g. in machine tools.

Name: Anthropotechnik
Definition: Anthropotechnology pursues the goal of adapting machines and technical equipment to the characteristics, possibilities and needs of people in such a way that both work together with the best possible overall result in terms of performance, reliability and economy.

Name: Prozessoptimierung
Definition: For technical processes; for chemical reactions on a laboratory scale use SW Reaction optimization

Name: Sicherheitstraining
Definition: concerns technical safety

Name: Sortieren
Definition: not only to be used in the field of technology, separation by material type

Name: Accident prevention regulation
Definition: Accident prevention regulations serve the purpose of preventive occupational health and safety and are issued to specify or supplement state occupational health and safety regulations; they are drawn up as orders of the accident insurance institutions (employers' liability insurance associations); they are binding for companies and insured persons with the approval of the Federal Labour Ministry; individual accident prevention regulations are set; the intellectual creator is determined in accordance with RDA 19.2.1.1.1 b).

Name: New technology
Definition: Summarizing term for the new quality of technical progress marked by information and nuclear technology, biotechnology, microelectronics, etc.

Name: Neuheit
Definition: Concept of patent law and design law

Name: Sicherheitsplanung
Definition: Planning to assess and prevent risks

Name: Technischer Beruf
Definition: Generic term for all technical professions at all levels of training

Name: Einbau
Definition: Used for the activity and for fixtures.

Name: Technical surface
Definition: For special surfaces, the respective substance is linked to USW surface; e.g. graphite ; s surface

Name: CAD Video somatography
Definition: Form of anthropometric workplace design

Name: Taguchi method
Definition: Special statistical procedures introduced by H. Taguchi. Quality assurance

Name: ÖNORM
Definition: See also under the individual standard

Name: Technische Unterlage
Definition: Not ben. for the documentation process, but for the document.

Name: Industrial heritage
Definition: Vehicles, machinery, household goods, instruments, furnishings, technical monuments and industrial buildings

Name: SNIP standard
Definition: See also under d. einz. Standard, e.g. SNIP 2-23-81

Name: Zertifizierungsstelle
Definition: Institution that checks compliance with the (DIN) standard

Name: Process development technology
Definition: Mainly used as a process engineering term

Name: EN-pre-standard
Definition: Single. Pre-standards as ENV plus digit, e.g., ENV 206

Name: Mehrstufenprozess
Definition: Used for multi-stage processes in process engineering, nuclear physics, etc.

Name: Technical harmonization
Definition: Integration of norms and standards across a larger region

Name: Pioniererfindung
Definition: Groundbreaking invention that opens up a wide range of applications

Name: Probabilistic safety analysis
Definition: Analysis method for the safety of nuclear facilities based on event and fault trees

Name: Continuous operation
Definition: Not just for chemical engineering

Name: Nanotechnologie
Definition: Design, construction and use of devices, machines, etc. consisting of elements of atomic size

Name: Work tool
Definition: Index as specifically as possible, e.g. hand tools, agricultural equipment

Name: Incident analysis
Definition: Investigation of an incident that has occurred (failure of a technical system)

Name: Operational monitoring
Definition: Used for technical aspects

Name: Intelligente Konstruktion
Definition: Technical design that is capable of self-correcting faults so that the functionality of the design is maintained

Name: PATIS
Definition: Patent information system of the German Patent Office

Name: Wartungsfreundlichkeit
Definition: Used for maintenance properties of systems, machines and devices

Name: Protective device Safety device
Definition: Serves as hazard protection for technical equipment

Name: Technical Communication Research Award
Definition: Awarded annually since 1980 by the ALCATEL-SEL Foundation for Communication Research on the subject of "People and Technology in Communication Systems".

Name: Minimalkonstruktion
Definition: Contains only the essential components

Name: Quality assurance
Definition: Not identical with quality assurance

Name: Adaptronik
Definition: Adaptronics is an artificial word made up of adaptive and electronics. Adaptronics is an interdisciplinary science that deals with the design of adaptive (self-adapting), actively reacting mechanical structural systems. Unlike in mechatronics, the actuators used in adaptronics are integrated directly into the force flow and utilize the elastomechanical properties of the materials used.

Name: Dimension technology
Definition: Size of objects determined by measurement

Name: Citizens' assets
Definition: Civ. Assets with right of use by citizens

Name: Austrian Association of Engineers and Architects Anniversary 1923
Definition: On the occasion of the 75th anniversary

Name: Fotogravurzeichner
Definition: Apprenticeship from 1961-1998

Name: PAS Technology
Definition: technical rules or agreements made within a company or a group of companies

Name: Naturumlauf
Definition: With natural circulation, the water-steam circulation is achieved due to the difference in density between the water in the downpipes and the water-steam phase in the heated evaporator section. The steam generator of the water tube boiler type, natural circulation boiler, is based on this principle of natural circulation.

Name: Feature technology
Definition: Type of image or design element display or performance feature of hardware and/or software

Name: Sicherheitsanalyse
Definition: In-depth systematic consideration of plant safety when planning new plants and when modifying plants and adapting them to the current state of safety technology. (Definition according to Lex. Umwelttechnik)

Name: Aufriss
Definition: Image of an object in its perpendicular parallel projection onto a vertical plane

Name: Kehrichtschaufel
Definition: Small hand shovel to pick up the swept up dust and dirt.

Name: Braiding technology
Definition: For all braidable materials

Name: Konzepthalter
Definition: Holding device for the concept (e.g. on a typewriter)

Name: Schnittmodell
Definition: Model showing an object in section.

Name: Kohlenschaufel
Definition: Shovel for filling the coal stove or oven

Name: Wirbelerzeuger
Definition: Special installations in flow ducts that generate longitudinal vortices, e.g. delta wings, delta winglets, rectangular wings, swept wings, swirl plates...

Name: Sichtfeld
Definition: Geometrically limited view, e.g. from a window or a motor vehicle

Name: Modelltechnik
Definition: Production and application of technical models (model tests...; cf. B 1996 Model <technology> and similarity theory)

Name: Design technology
Definition: One of the Main phases of the construction process

Name: Technical infrastructure
Definition: z. e.g. transportation, supply and disposal, telecommunications infrastructure

Name: Wilhelm Kress anniversary 1986
Definition: Celebration of the 150th birthday

Name: Wasserkocher
Definition: Electrically heated pot or jug with lid for heating water

Name: Mischbauweise
Definition: Construction with different materials

Name: Anschauungsmodell
Definition: models built for presentation, teaching and similar purposes, e.g. architectural models

Name: Warnschild
Definition: Sign with written and/or pictorial instructions for accident prevention. Information for accident prevention; warning signs used for warning signs in traffic

Name: Computational nanotechnology
Definition: Branch of science that combines the field of nanotechnology with computer science methods and vice versa

Name: Functionality
Definition: In technology and IT, functionality refers to the ability of a product or component to fulfill a specific function or group of functions.

Name: Biotechnik
Definition: Biotechnology is an interdisciplinary science that deals with the use of enzymes, cells and entire organisms in technical applications.

Name: Technischer Systemplaner
Definition: Apprenticeship occupation, replaces the job title of technical draftsman as of 01.08.2011

Name: FabLab
Definition: A FabLab (fabrication laboratory) is an open, democratic high-tech workshop with the aim of making industrial production processes for individual items available to private individuals. Typical equipment includes 3D printers, laser cutters, CNC machines, presses for deep drawing or milling in order to be able to process a large number of different materials and workpieces ("make almost everything"). FabLabs enable the uncomplicated production of highly individualized one-off items or spare parts that are no longer available (rapid manufacturing).

Name: Assistive technology
Definition: Technology for all types of assistive devices for people with disabilities

Name: Vibrationsanalyse
Definition: Inspection method of rotating parts for faults such as imbalances or defective bearings

Name: Selbstreparatur
Definition: With self-repair, faulty parts of a system are repaired by the system itself.

Name: Vereinzelungsanlage
Definition: Structural system for controlling access to a room or area (e.g. turnstile)

Name: Sound vessel
Definition: According to Vitruvius, vessels set up in ancient theaters to amplify sound, which were handed down as walled-in sound vessels in the choir of medieval church buildings.

Name: Completely Knocked Down
Definition: The term Completely Knocked Down (CKD) refers to a method of manufacturing and marketing motor vehicles or machines, etc., in which components and assemblies are delivered and only assembled into the finished vehicle or machine and sold in the country of import.

Name: Service design
Definition: Service design refers to the process of designing services. It is a branch of design and is usually carried out by designers in close cooperation with companies or organizations in order to methodically develop customer and market-oriented services.

Name: MBSE Technology
Definition: MBSE is a summary term for an interdisciplinary approach to systems engineering that combines the tried-and-tested procedures of traditional systems engineering with strict visual modeling techniques. In doing so, MBSE deals with the design, specification, verification and validation of complex systems in a system model that accompanies the entire development process and represents the source of the essential development artifacts for requirements, architecture and testing.

Name: Biohybrid system
Definition: A biohybrid system is a combined system of elements, parts and components consisting of organic material and inorganic material.

Name: Rotary union
Definition: A rotating union enables fluids (gases, liquids) to pass between a stationary body and a rotating body, or between bodies rotating against each other.

Name: Mechanical load
Definition: Load refers to all external forces (forces and moments) that act on a component, but external constraints or displacements are also often summarized under this term, which, according to Newton's reaction principle, leads to a stress in the component if the loads do not cancel each other out

Name: Flexoelectricity
Definition: Flexoelectricity is a material property of a dielectric that exhibits spontaneous electrical polarization as a result of a deformation gradient. This means that the material exhibits an internal mechanical stress and deforms when a voltage is applied or supplies a current when it is deformed. The thinner the material, the stronger the flexo-electric effect.

Name: Quantentechnologie
Definition: Quantum technology is a field of physics and engineering in which quantum effects, i.e. specific properties and degrees of freedom of quantum mechanics, are utilized. The relevant technologies are to be transferred in particular into practical applications in quantum computing such as quantum computers, quantum sensors and metrology, quantum cryptology and communication as well as quantum simulation

Name: Eierkocher
Definition: Electric appliance for cooking eggs

Name: Wicklung
Definition: Winding of a material in a solid aggregate state around an axis

Name: Koppelnutzung
Definition: The use of a by-product alongside a main raw material or product

Name: FreeCAD
Definition: Open source CAD program, programming languages C++ and Python, etc.

Name: Forschungsanlage
Definition: Plant used for research purposes.

Name: Adhäsion
Definition: Adhesion is the adherence of two substances or bodies to each other. This is caused by the attractive forces between the molecules of the two substances (bodies).

Name: Balken
Definition: Without explanatory addition for the construction industry

Name: Multibody system
Definition: Substitute system for the description of complex mechanical systems

Name: Stoffübertragung
Definition: Summarizing term for diffusion, osmosis, permeation, processes with forced convection ;also SW mass transport <biology> available

Name: Load capacity
Definition: The load capacity indicates the maximum load-bearing capacity in the field of technology.

Name: Wärmeübertragung
Definition: Heat transfer the transfer of heat from a place of higher temperature to a place of lower temperature.

Name: Deformation
Definition: In continuum mechanics, the deformation (also known as distortion) of a body is the change in its shape as a result of the effect of an external force.

Name: Baustatik
Definition: If terms from physics, e.g. truss or folded structure, are used in structural analysis, they are assigned system no. 31.3b.

Name: Kennzahl
Definition: A key figure is a measure that is used for quantification and is based on a regulation for the quantitative, reproducible measurement of a quantity, state or process.

Name: Reibungswiderstand
Definition: Reibung, auch Friktion oder Reibungswiderstand genannt, ist eine Kraft, die zwischen sich berührenden Körpern oder Teilchen wirkt.

Name: Temperaturverteilung
Definition: Used for spatial (SW temperature gradient) and temporal (SW temperature fluctuation, temperature curve) distributions

Name: Strukturmechanik
Definition: For structures consisting of several partial bodies that are often deformable.

Name: Transonic flow
Definition: Ma between 0.8 and 1.2

Name: Viskoplastizität
Definition: Collective term for the behavior of substances that have both viscous and plastic properties.

Name: Boundary layer detachment
Definition: In fluid mechanics, a stall is the separation of the flow from the surface of a flowing object.

Name: Fachwerk
Definition: Ben in the field of civil engineering and technical mechanics, for half-timbered houses etc ben SW half-timbered construction.

Name: Strukturoptimierung
Definition: Optimization of mechanical structures, e.g. designing components under given load conditions in such a way that an optimum force flow is realized and a weight-optimized structure is achieved.

Name: Timoshenko-Balken
Definition: The Timoshenko beam theory extends the classical Euler-Bernoulli beam theory by an additional spatial derivative of the 2nd degree: in addition to the changed inertia of a deformed beam, shear deformation is also taken into account in the equation of motion.

Name: Schadensmechanik
Definition: Describes fracture processes in materials

Name: Panelverfahren
Definition: Numerical method for solving the potential equation

Name: Vuilleumier process
Definition: Thermodynamic cycle

Name: Akustooptik
Definition: Sound waves influence light (usually diffraction)

Name: Heavy gas
Definition: Gas, heavier than air

Name: Edge zone flow
Definition: Frictional flow

Name: Finite volume method
Definition: The finite volume method is a numerical method for the discretization of conservation equations, i.e. special partial differential equations based on a conservation law.

Name: Strukturdynamik
Definition: Deals with vibration processes of structures, e.g. bridges, airplanes or turbomachinery.

Name: Tragverhalten
Definition: "Load-bearing behavior" describes how a component behaves under a load; it can be compressed, crack, buckle, buckle and ultimately collapse. "Load-bearing capacity" is the load (weight) that a component can bear.

Name: Drehwinkel
Definition: Both meanings according to B 1986 are not differentiated by HZ

Name: Elektronenstrahltomografie
Definition: Method for determining magnetic and electric microfields

Name: Windkanalkorrektur
Definition: Conversion of the measurement results to the conditions in the free atmosphere

Name: Fluid-Struktur-Wechselwirkung
Definition: Deals with the mutual influence of structure and flow. A fluid mechanics problem and a structural mechanics problem are coupled with each other. The pressure distribution resulting from the flow provides the load condition for the structural mechanics problem, the deformations resulting from the structural mechanics provide the geometry of the deformed component for the fluid mechanics problem.

Name: Scheffel
Definition: Old German unit of volume for dry goods, especially for grain, flour and fruit. A bushel was also used to describe an area of land that required one bushel of seed grain to be cultivated.

Name: Galloping oscillation
Definition: Self-excited aeroelastic oscillation transverse to the direction of flow

Name: Particle Image Velocimetry
Definition: Measurement of velocity fields in a flow plane with the aid of particle mapping

Name: Baumechanik
Definition: Structural mechanics is the generic term for structural analysis, strength of materials, vibration theory, elasticity theory, etc.

Name: Passive vibration damping
Definition: feedback-free vibration damping without energy supply

Name: Wind-wave channel
Definition: Test facility similar to the wind tunnel

Name: Thermorheologie
Definition: Rheology as a function of the thermal state

Name: Clausius-Rankine process
Definition: Thermodynamic cycle, especially with steam-powered engines

Name: Reissner-Theorie
Definition: Method for calculating components

Name: Dampfphase
Definition: Gas phase for compounds above the boiling point

Name: Scherschicht
Definition: In fluid mechanics, the shear layer refers to the transition area between two parallel flows with different velocities.

Name: Particle tracking velocimetry
Definition: Measurement of velocity fields in a flow plane with the aid of particle trajectory mapping

Name: Particle-Streak-Velocimetry
Definition: Measurement of velocity fields in a flow plane with the aid of particle trajectory images. The difference to PTV is the use of longer exposure times

Name: Thermohydraulik
Definition: Hydraulics with hot pressurized water

Name: Diffusing body
Definition: Body on which scattering of particles takes place

Name: Knickbeanspruchung
Definition: Used for the load directed onto a component from the outside

Name: Flat stress state
Definition: In a biaxial or plane stress state, two principal stresses are in the load directions, the third principal stress perpendicular to the plane is zero.

Name: Internal flow
Definition: enclosed flow, is used when no more specific SW such as pipe flow, channel flow can be used.

Name: Hebebalken
Definition: Gable beam known to be used in the Netherlands to lift bulky goods to the upper floors of narrow buildings

Name: Materialgleichung
Definition: Phenomenolog. Equations for the description of material properties; in the theory of continua (e.g. irreversible thermodynamics) they complement the balance equations to form a complete system of equations.

Name: Visioplasticity
Definition: The visioplasticity method is used to experimentally determine stress and force

Name: Light gas
Definition: Gas that is lighter than air

Name: Reibungsmoment
Definition: The frictional torque is a mechanical torque, defined as the product of frictional force and effective distance

Name: Topologieoptimierung
Definition: Topology optimization uses an FE analysis to remove non-stressed material, thus minimizing the weight of the component

Name: Isogeometric analysis
Definition: Isogeometric analysis is a computer-aided calculation process based on functions that represent a geometric object. Instead of developing an FEM that approximates the geometry of an object, the functions that describe the geometry of the object are used directly.

Name: Halton episode
Definition: The Halton sequence is a multidimensional mathematical sequence.

Name: Diagrid
Definition: Supporting structures made of diagonal steel lattice girders that combine massive material savings with a gain in freely usable floor space and more flexibility

Name: Wärmeaustausch
Definition: Heat exchange General term for the transport and transfer of thermal energy between bodies of different temperatures (heat transfer)

Name: Electrochemical scanning tunneling microscope
Definition: The electrochemical scanning tunneling microscope is a modification of the scanning tunneling microscope and was developed in 1988 by K. Itaya and E. Tomita in 1988.

Name: Laval runner
Definition: Model of an elastic-bending rotor consisting of a disk with mass and an elastic but massless round shaft.

Name: NACA-Profile
Definition: Are two-dimensional cross-sections of airfoils for airplane wings developed by the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics (NACA) for the design of airfoils.

Name: Flash vaporization
Definition: Evaporation of superheated fluids

Name: Akustofluidik
Definition: Sound waves influence currents.

Name: Machzahl
Definition: The Mach number is a dimensionless fluid mechanics parameter for velocities and indicates the ratio of the velocity of, for example, a body or a fluid to the speed of sound of the surrounding fluid.

Name: Regenerosion
Definition: From the perspective of rain erosion, the cause of certain erosion events is described and not initially their effect. The main influencing variables of rain erosion are the impact velocity and the droplet size. The kinetic energy acting on a surface can be derived from them.

Name: TAU-Code
Definition: The flow solver TAU calculates the compressible three-dimensional Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations on unstructured meshes.

Name: FLOWer program
Definition: The program solves the Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations for the nodes of a structured mesh for steady and unsteady flows. FLOWer is based on a block-structured finite volume approach. Numerous options are available for the consideration of solid body motions and deformations.

Name: Fluent program
Definition: The flow solver FLUENT is a commercial program distributed by the company ANSYS. The program solves the Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations on unstructured and structured meshes.

Name: Treibstrahl
Definition: A motive jet can be a liquid or gas jet that sucks in another medium (suction medium) by exchanging momentum, accelerates it and compresses/conveys it, provided it is under sufficient pressure.

Name: Thermomechanical load
Definition: Is the superimposition of a mechanical load with a thermal load.

Name: Trace program
Definition: Trace is a standard CFD method for turbomachinery flows. The computer program has been developed at the DLR Institute of Propulsion Technology since the 1990s.

Name: Load Unit of measurement
Definition: Old unit of measurement, mainly used in northern Europe and in the Hanseatic League's sphere of influence. The bushel served as a sub-unit.

Name: Opus craticium
Definition: Ancient Roman type of half-timbered construction, used in Herculaneum, among other places

Name: Regelungstechnik
Definition: Only HSW, for control engineering objects use control as non-permutating USW

Name: Steuerungstechnik
Definition: Only HSW, as non-permutating USW use control

Name: Teilchenmesstechnik
Definition: Measurement of characteristics (size, velocity, etc.) of solid particles, agglomerates, droplets and bubbles

Name: Dynamic measurement
Definition: Measurement of time-dependent variables

Name: Electrochemical sensor
Definition: is linked to biosensor if necessary

Name: Fluidtechnik
Definition: Fluid technology is a generic term for all processes in which energy is transferred by the flow of gases or liquids.

Name: Frequenzgangverfahren
Definition: Controller adjustment procedure

Name: Telemetrie
Definition: Electr. transmission of measured values over long distances distances

Name: Thermoelement
Definition: A thermocouple is a pair of metallic conductors made of different materials that are connected at one end and are suitable for measuring temperature due to the thermoelectric effect.

Name: Audio frequency ripple control
Definition: With audio frequency ripple control, audio frequency pulses are superimposed on the supply network, which cause the connected ripple control receivers to perform certain switching operations.

Name: Winkelauflösung
Definition: Measurement of radiation, particle flux, etc. at different angles as seen from the measuring instrument

Name: Proximity switch
Definition: New catch under proximity switch

Name: Feldbus
Definition: Used for networking sensor and actuator systems

Name: Einsatzgewicht
Definition: Weights that are placed one inside the other

Name: Saugsonde
Definition: Device for obtaining leachate samples from the soil

Name: FOM probe
Definition: Reflectance meter in food monitoring

Name: Measurement and control mechanic
Definition: Training occupation until 1987, replaced by process control electronics technician.

Name: Differentialsensor
Definition: Arrangement of two individual sensors with opposing modulation

Name: Temperaturprogrammierung
Definition: Program-controlled temperature regulation

Name: Messeinrichtung
Definition: Entirety of all parts that record the value of the measured variable

Name: Fluid dynamic control
Definition: Thrust vector control through secondary injection

Name: Mess- und Regelmechanikerin
Definition: Replaced the office machine mechanic , from 2003 replaced by the information electronics technician specializing in office systems technology

Name: Wasserkanal
Definition: A water tunnel is a facility for investigating currents, similar to a wind tunnel

Name: International temperature scale
Definition: Scale valid from 1990 as successor to the "International Practical Temperature Scale"

Name: Direct self-regulation
Definition: Method for highly dynamic control of rotary field machines

Name: Zustimmungsschalter
Definition: Further development of the dead man's device, especially for machine protection

Name: Electromagnetic reflection method
Definition: Geophysical method for the exploration of potash and rock salt deposits

Name: Myriameterstein
Definition: Historical survey marker

Name: Heat flow calorimeter
Definition: Calorimeter whose measuring cell is coupled to the thermostat via a thermally conductive bridge, so that a very small temperature difference is achieved

Name: Mettler scales
Definition: Analytical balance invented by Erhard Mettler around 1945/46

Name: Aktivsammler
Definition: Akzeptorfläche zur Messung gasförmiger Immissionen

Name: Phase Doppler anemometry
Definition: Measurement of frequency and phase shift, therefore also suitable for particle measurement technology

Name: Eichstempel
Definition: Stamp as proof of calibration

Name: Hydrometric sash
Definition: Device for measuring discharge in open channels

Name: Pressiometer
Definition: Device for determining the pressure conditions in the ground

Name: Phase comparison method Navigation technology
Definition: Digital phase measurement system for solving navigation tasks

Name: Laserscanner
Definition: can be linked with optical sensor

Name: Fernbedienung
Definition: Device for controlling various functions of electrical devices and systems without direct manual adjustment on the device

Name: Microcontroller 53C700
Definition: SCSI microcontroller

Name: Hydrometer
Definition: Device for determining the density of liquids

Name: COBRA Oscillograph
Definition: Two-channel memory oscillograph

Name: Laserwaage
Definition: Electromechanical scales based on the laser principle

Name: Radiodensitometrie
Definition: Densitometric examination of X-ray images

Name: Gittersensor

By choosing between electrically conductive and electrically capacitive measurement, you can analyze any solid-free multiphase flow type. Examples are water/air, water/steam or oil/gas flows.

Name: Schlitzrohrsonde

Name: Induktionsthermographie
Definition: Inductively excited thermography is a completely non-contact method for non-destructive material testing. An alternating current flowing in a coil (inductor) induces a current in an electrically conductive test object in the opposite direction.  The increased current density at the crack ends causes the test object to heat up more at the crack ends, which is measured with an infrared camera.

Name: Dielektrischer Elastomer-Aktor

Name: Planar actuator

Name: Multispektralkamera

Multispectral cameras consist of four, six or nine measuring cameras mounted on a carrier with approximately the same internal orientation. The recording axes are aligned exactly parallel to ensure that the recorded images are congruent. The lenses are combined with different filters and films (panchromatic, black and white, infrared). Geometrically identical black and white photos of a scene are created, which record different spectral content due to the respective film-filter combinations.
