Name: Hugo Häring Award
Alternate Name: Awards for good buildings in Baden-Württemberg
Definition: 1st stage of the selection procedure for the Hugo Häring Prize of the BDA Baden-Württemberg

Name: Premi Joves Arquitectes
Definition: Catalan Architecture Prize, awarded for the first time in 1996

Name: Grubenwerk
Definition: Late Neolithic landscape structures in western Europe consisting of simple or concentric ramparts and pits interrupted by narrow earth bridges

Name: Gatehouse
Definition: Small house as a service room/residential building for doorman, gatekeeper, porter, concierge, etc.

Name: Illusory door
Definition: In ancient times, a stone slab (or wooden slab) - often painted and in relief - indicating a door in tomb houses

Name: Arkosolium
Definition: Architecturally monumentalized niche tomb in late antique-early Christian catacombs, rock tombs and burial structures

Name: Barrier temple construction
Definition: Walls that are inserted between pillars and columns up to a maximum of two thirds of their height, often with pictorial programs

Name: The best detached house
Definition: Awarded approximately every two years since 2005 by the architecture magazine IdealesHeim

Name: Zenitismus
Definition: Serbian-Croatian architecture and art movement of the twenties of the 20th century

Name: Konfuziustempel
Definition: Temple in honor of Confucius

Name: Atlant
Definition: In architecture and sculpture, a powerful male figure supporting an entablature

Name: Semperpreis
Definition: Awarded every two years by the Saxon Academy of Arts with the Saxon State Foundation for Nature and the Environment (LaNU) and Vattenfall Europe Mining & Generation (donor), endowed with 25,000 euros

Name: Erdkeller
Definition: Basement with a floor that is in contact with the ground

Name: Brautpforte
Definition: The bridal gate, also known as the bridal door or bridal portal, is the name of a covered portal usually located on the north side of Gothic churches. The wedding ceremony took place in front of this portal or in a room adjoining the bridal door until the 11th century, as it was essentially considered a secular act

Name: Constructive Alps Prize, Award
Alternate Name: International award for sustainable renovation and new building in the Alps
International Award for Sustainable Refurbishment and Construction in the Alps
Prix d'architecture international pour la rénovation et la construction durables dans les Alpes
Premio internazionale di architettura per le ristrutturazioni e costruzioni sostenibili nelle Alpi
Definition: Alpine-wide architecture prize awarded for the first time in 2010 under the name "Constructive - Liechtenstein Prize for Sustainable Building and Renovation in the Alps"; awarded jointly by the Principality of Liechtenstein and the Swiss Confederation every two years from 2013 under the name "Constructive Alps".

Name: Horizontal wheel water mill
Definition: Water mill with a horizontal water wheel

Name: Tokonoma
Definition: Picture niche with raised floor in the Japanese house for displaying individual works of art

Name: Distinction de l'Ouest
Definition: Triennial prize for architecture, landscape architecture and urban planning in the "Ouest lausannois" planning zone, which comprises the 8 municipalities of Bussigny, Chavannes, Crissier, Ecublens, Prilly, Renens, Saint-Sulpice and Villars-Sainte-Croix, awarded for the first time in 2018

Name: Parametric architecture
Definition: A term coined by architect Patrik Schumacher in 2009 for the application of natural construction principles in architecture and urban planning.

Name: Überetscher style
Definition: Regional architectural style in the period 1550 - 1650; late Gothic construction with elements of the Italian Renaissance

Name: Googie architecture
Definition: Futurist. Form of architecture and design influenced by American car culture and space travel. Car culture and space travel, late 1940s - mid 1960s in Southern California, Douglas Haskell coined the term in 1952 after the "Googies" coffee house in Hollywood designed by John Lautner in 1949

Name: Dombaumeisterin
Definition: Head of a cathedral building workshop for the construction and maintenance of cathedrals and minsters

Name: Baumeisterin
Definition: Used for the historical profession as well as for the current job title in Austria and Switzerland

Name: Futuro (house)
Definition: In 1968, the Finnish architect Matti Suuronen developed an ellipsoidal, 36 m² round house, largely made of plastic and standing on a metal frame, which was intended to be used as a mountain hut, weekend house, etc.

Name: Andron
Definition: Men's room of the ancient Greek house

Name: Tiburio
Definition: A typical Lombardo-Romanesque quadrangular or polygonal tower-like construction element, with which the dome vault of an interior space was encased externally in a protective shell

Name: Hammerschloss
Definition: Representative residential buildings of hammer mill owners (so-called hammer lords), built in the Upper Palatinate from the 16th to 18th centuries

Name: Topological architecture
Definition: Architectural style that, based on the mathematical topology developed in the 19th century, uses computer-aided design and animation software to create complex and dynamic architectural configurations with spatial plasticity. Representatives include Stephen Perrella, Frank O. Gehry and Zara Hadid.

Name: Prémio Valmor
Alternate Name: Prémio Valmor e Municipal de Arquitetura
Definition: Annual architecture prize; founded by the city of Lisbon in 1898 and awarded for the first time in 1902

Name: Raiding Project
Definition: The Raiding Project is an art and architecture initiative whose aim is to build experimental guest houses by renowned Japanese architects in the municipality of Raiding.

Name: Latvijas Arhitektūras Gada Balva
Definition: annual Latvian architecture competition, since 1995

Name: Konkathedrale
Definition: Within the Catholic Church, term for a former cathedral or the second cathedral in a diocese

Name: Mesçit
Definition: Small mosque, prayer room or house without a pulpit in the Ottoman-Turkish area

Name: Arc Award
Definition: Architecture prize awarded annually by "Schweizer Baudokumentation" since 2012

Name: Ames room
Definition: A room whose walls and textures are distorted to create various optical illusions. Based on the ideas of Hermann von Helmholtz, the Ames room was developed in 1946 by the US American ophthalmologist and psychologist Adelbert Ames (1880-1955).

Name: Jamb house construction
Definition: Part of the outer wall of a building with a collar beam or purlin roof that extends beyond the ceiling of the top storey

Name: Imaret
Definition: Public cuisine in the Ottoman Empire

Name: Hotzenhaus
Definition: Single-roof house as it was built in past centuries, especially in the Hotzenwald, in the southern Black Forest

Name: Geodesic dome
Definition: Construction of spherical domes with a lattice shell made of triangles, invented around 1950 by US architect Buckminster Fuller

Name: Telesterion
Definition: In antiquity, the term for a mystery temple or a consecration chapel or hall for the Eleusinian gods, named after the Telesterion in the Demeter sanctuary at Eleusis

Name: Hagioskop
Definition: Wall opening in a medieval church building that allows a view of the altar from the outside; especially in many English churches

Name: Paul Bonatz Prize of the City of Stuttgart
Definition: Award, presented 1958-1983, for special merits and achievements in the field of architecture or urban planning in the state capital Stuttgart.

Name: About Upper Bavaria
Alternate Name: BDA Regional Award About Upper Bavaria
Regional Architecture Award About Upper Bavaria
Definition: Regional architecture prize awarded by the BDA Munich-Upper Bavaria District Association for the first time in 2020 and awarded for the first time in 2021 and every 3 years from then on.

Name: Corinthian order
Definition: Variant of the ionic order

Name: Kompositordnung
Definition: Column order with a composite capital, but also an order composed of parts of different classical orders with varied elements in entablature, frieze and cornice, particularly common in Roman architecture

Name: Column shaft
Definition: Load-bearing, statically necessary component of a column

Name: Best Workspaces
Alternate Name: "Best Workspaces - Solutions of the Year" competition
Definition: International architecture award for intelligent working environments and office buildings presented by the Callwey publishing house

Name: Agraffe Architecture
Definition: In architecture, a high wedge stone that connects two layers of stone in a hook shape, as the keystone of a round arch apex leading to the entablature

Name: Gurtgesims
Definition: moves the building between the individual floors

Name: Kranzgesims
Definition: A wide overhanging cornice that forms the horizontal finish at the base of the roof

Name: Volutengiebel
Definition: a gable framed on the side by volutes

Name: Segmentgiebel
Definition: Gable with segmental arched end - a flat circular segment replaces the gable triangle

Name: Wandpfeiler
Definition: in architecture, a pillar connected to the wall

Name: Blasted segmental gable
Definition: Segmental gable with the upper center left open

Name: Blasted triangular gable
Definition: Triangular gable with the top center left open

Name: Cranked triangular gable
Definition: Triangular gable with stepped forward or backward cornice

Name: Krabbe
Definition: leaf- or flower-like Gothic architectural ornamental form on the edges of gables, pinnacles, lashings or tower pyramids

Name: Feston Art
Definition: Decorative motif in the form of a hanging made of ribbons, flowers, fruit and foliage

Name: Diamantierung
Definition: ornamental form chiseled out in the form of gemstone facets on building elements

Name: Dependent
Definition: in architecture, a hanging keystone or knob at the intersections of beamed ceilings and suspended columns in open roof trusses

Name: Astragal Architecture
Definition: Ornament in the form of a string of pearls with pointed oval bars set in pairs in between

Name: Auslucht
Definition: in architecture, an oriel-like projection rising from the ground, usually several storeys high

Name: Entlastungsbogen
Definition: in construction, a masonry vault mounted above a lintel beam

Name: Bosse Architecture
Definition: untreated or unsmoothed surface of a block, e.g. ashlar

Name: Tambour Architecture
Definition: Cylindrical or polygonal substructure of a dome, can be fitted with windows

Name: Tabulariummotiv
Definition: Wall structure consisting of pillar arcades with half-columns in front of them

Name: Mezzanin
Definition: Intermediate or mezzanine floor, usually between the ground floor and second floor or directly under the roof

Name: Schwebegiebel
Definition: Gable-side projecting rafters are held at the base by a triangular brace that lies on the projecting frame and cannot be moved in itself

Name: Staffelgiebel
Definition: Gable projecting above the roof with stepped contour

Name: Kolossalordnung
Definition: Column arrangement in which the columns or pilasters with plinths span two or more storeys

Name: Hermenpilaster
Definition: Pilaster tapering downwards, ends at the top with a figure or capital

Name: Banding architecture
Definition: The surface of a structural element is called banded if it consists of horizontal stripes (bands) that differ in material, color and/or depth

Name: Giebelgaupe
Definition: The gable wall of the dormer ends above the gable roof of the dormer

Name: Torfahrthaus
Definition: house type common in south-western Germany from the 18th to the early 20th century; characterized by the gateway, usually at the side, through which the rear courtyard, the outbuildings and the staircase were accessible; builders were often urban craftsmen, merchants and factory owners who lived in part of the house or rented it out as required and ran a business on the ground floor and courtyard

Name: Volutenkonsole
Definition: a spiral-shaped projection protruding from the wall on which other components rest

Name: Industriebaupreis
Definition: Awarded every two years since 2016 for buildings and urban planning facilities with outstanding industrial and commercial architecture

Name: Grotto architecture
Definition: Originally the name for a cave or rock cellar, later a stone pantry with natural cooling, from which the typical taverns and taverns in Ticino, the canton of Graubünden and northern Italy developed from the 19th century onwards.

Name: Alkoven
Definition: in Arabic architecture, a (vaulted) bed recess, followed in European architecture by a windowless adjoining room, usually used as a bedchamber, which adjoins a larger room like an alcove; particularly common in 17th and 18th century France.

Name: Pferdeschwemme
Definition: Accessible fountain for horses; place near local watercourses, ponds or similar where horses are driven into the water to clean, water or cool them down

Name: Weiherhaus
Definition: Tower-like aristocratic or patrician residence on an island in a pond or lake, not or only slightly fortified, occurring since the 13th century mainly in southern Germany, especially the Nuremberg region, and in Switzerland, later often converted into manor houses

Name: Real estate of the year
Alternate Name: Callwey Award "Real Estate of the Year"
Definition: From 2023, the Callwey publishing house will award an annual prize in the field of architecture and building planning to architects and clients in German-speaking countries

Name: Potemkin village
Definition: alleged village dummies that Potjomkin had built to feign prosperity in order to deceive Catherine II. during a journey. Today used as a figure of speech for deception, false pretenses, ...

Name: Gegendenkmal
Definition: Monument that represents an antithesis to existing monuments, whose message can no longer be supported, but which cannot be changed or removed.

Name: Bemessung
Definition: In engineering, design refers to the design of components so that they can fulfill their defined purpose. This can relate to all aspects of design, construction, manufacture, operation and end use.

Name: Ingenieurbiologie
Definition: The science of the biological effects of structural changes in the landscape structure and the utilization of biological findings in necessary technical interventions in the landscape.

Name: Painters and varnishers
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Schale
Definition: Without explanatory addition for the construction industry

Name: Ufereinfassung
Definition: Structural measures to secure the banks in harbors, e.g. quay walls, etc.

Name: Thermal insulation
Definition: For technical and non-technical (e.g. biological) issues

Name: Bauzeichner
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Rules of architecture
Definition: nur für Sekundärliteratur

Name: Ingenieurgeologie
Definition: Branch of Applied Geology and Geotechnics

Name: Dachdecker
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Versorgungsleitung
Definition: Used as a collective term for water pipes, gas pipes and electrical lines

Name: Betonzuschlag
Definition: Piles of crushed or uncrushed grains of mineral materials such as gravel, crushed stone or chippings

Name: Stuckateur
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Abbinden
Definition: used for the solidification of binding agents, e.g. in the construction industry

Name: Asphaltbauer
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Bauhandwerker
Definition: The job title of construction worker or construction craftsman is commonly used for all persons who work on a construction site or are involved in construction work. However, the term construction worker is not a training occupation or a fixed job title.

Name: Mauer
Definition: Not used in the sense of structures for border security at national borders; use SW Border fortification

Name: Peeling Construction
Definition: Only for surface treatment, e.g. for concrete

Name: Composite girder
Definition: Used for all beams made of composite material (not only steel-concrete)

Name: Vorspannung
Definition: Without HZ for the mechanical preload

Name: Wasserbauwerker
Definition: Apprenticeship until 1991, replaced by the profession of hydraulic engineer

Name: Kunststoffbeton
Definition: Concrete in which plastic is the sole binder

Name: Glaserarbeit
Definition: Only for work performance, otherwise ben. SW Glazing or glass construction

Name: Efflorescence
Definition: verknüpfe mit Anwendungsgebiet

Name: Bauverfahren
Definition: Technical treatment, organization, sequence, etc.

Name: Betonzusatzstoff
Definition: Finely divided mineral. Substances such as colorants or pozzolanic fines

Name: Betonzusatzmittel
Definition: Liquid or powdered admixtures Additives up to 50 g/kg such as flowing agents, air-entraining agents, concrete plasticizers

Name: Brechsand
Definition: Sand from crushed rock

Name: Gipsplatte
Definition: Not identical to plasterboard

Name: Tresorraum
Definition: Walk-in safe, armored vault

Name: Nachbehandlung
Definition: Only for technology; for medicine use rehabilitation

Name: Umkehrdach
Definition: Thermal insulation layer lies above the actual roof seal

Name: Mischbauart
Definition: Type of construction in which the structure is built using a combination of assembly construction and conventional construction.

Name: Druckstollen
Definition: Water tunnels of dams and hydroelectric power plants through which pressurized water flows up to the crest

Name: Interior insulation
Definition: Thermal insulation of building components

Name: Tragkabel
Definition: Load-bearing cable for buildings and cable cars

Name: Mobilheim
Definition: House on wheels, mobile home, incorrectly translated in Pons as caravan; these are houses that are mobile and are transported from time to time

Name: Metallbauer
Definition: United locksmiths and (construction) blacksmiths

Name: Klotzung
Definition: Measure for stabilizing glazing

Name: Subfloor Construction
Definition: Bottom layer of a floor covering

Name: Bauprodukt
Definition: OB for building materials, building components and building services equipment

Name: Building envelope
Definition: Entirety of the components enveloping a building, e.g. outer wall and roof

Name: Bauarbeit
Definition: For work on the construction site or on structural installations.

Name: Ausziehversuch
Definition: Procedure for testing building materials

Name: Underground routing
Definition: Used for traffic routes that generally run above ground

Name: U-profile
Definition: U-shaped cross-section

Name: Strahlschuttprobe
Definition: Sample of sandblasting residues on steel structures

Name: Unbound base course
Definition: Base course without binder

Name: Notausgang
Definition: Emergency and disaster exit

Name: Fischaufstiegsanlage
Definition: Device that enables fish to overcome artificial obstacles in flowing waters

Name: Controlled ground failure
Definition: Artificially induced ground failure

Name: Tageslichtelement
Definition: Transparent plastic component

Name: Simple rules
Definition: Design basis for simple masonry structures without structural analysis

Name: Mauersteinverband
Definition: Type of interlocking of the bricks.

Name: Wasserschaden
Definition: Damage caused by water ingress

Name: Schlitzdecke
Definition: Ceiling of a structure with openings, e.g. in tunnels

Name: Grünbrücke
Definition: Structures over roads that are primarily or exclusively intended to facilitate the movement of wild animals

Name: Wasserbauer
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Einfachausbau
Definition: TT of road construction

Name: Road assessment
Definition: Investigation of the need to upgrade roads

Name: Sektionaltor
Definition: Lifting door in slat design for garages etc.

Name: Kanalisierung
Definition: Generally used to make rivers navigable

Name: Knagge
Definition: In structural engineering, a piece of wood or sheet steel to support another structural element

Name: Unterwasser
Definition: Water below a barrage

Name: Brunnenstube
Definition: Collecting basin for the water of a fountain

Name: Flowing screed
Definition: Self-levelling screed

Name: Bleeding construction
Definition: Water separation from concrete mixtures due to the different densities of cement and concrete aggregate on the one hand and water on the other.

Name: Naturwerksteinmechaniker
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Bauwerksabdichter
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Construction equipment operator
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Isolierfacharbeiter
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Estrichleger
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Backfill Construction
Definition: Anthropogenic backfill in construction

Name: Konsolidation
Definition: Reduction of excess pore water pressure in the soil

Name: Oblique twist
Definition: Torsion, e.g. of roadways

Name: Thermal diode wall
Definition: A wickless heat pipe (thermosyphon) is connected with its lower part (evaporation zone) to an absorber surface, which forms the outer surface of a house wall

Name: Flachglasmechaniker
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf in Nordrhein-Westfalen

Name: Schalsteinbauweise
Definition: Stone-like hollow bodies are laid dry in a bond without mortar and filled with concrete once a certain wall section height has been reached.

Name: Kunstharzmodifizierter Zementbeton
Definition: Cement concrete in which part of the cement binder is replaced by plastic.

Name: Rollo
Definition: Roll-up curtain

Name: Injection dowels
Definition: Special anchors for fastenings in hollow masonry

Name: Brettstapelbau
Definition: Special type of timber construction

Name: Festo Airtecture
Definition: Hall construction developed by Festo-Pneumatic, whose components (columns, walls, windows, ceiling, floor, ropes) consist of inflated textile hollow bodies, used e.g. as stabling, exhibition and production halls.

Name: Perimeter insulation
Definition: Exterior insulation of components in contact with the ground

Name: Painter and varnisher, specializing in painting
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Sanierputz
Definition: Moisture and salt-resistant special plaster

Name: Schornsteinkopf
Definition: Part of the chimney from the exit from the roof to the chimney mouth

Name: Massivdecke
Definition: Collective term for all ceiling constructions not made of wood

Name: Quellbarkeit
Definition: Ability to store water molecules

Name: Freispiegelstollen
Definition: Water tunnels of dams and hydropower plants that are not filled to the top

Name: Durchbruch
Definition: Subsequent openings in walls, ceilings or through building blocks

Name: Sunk
Definition: Unsteady lowering of the water level in a channel and propagating in it

Name: Raft alley
Definition: In dams, an inclined channel in which the rafts float from the upper water to the lower water

Name: Betonzusatz
Definition: Substances for influencing the properties of concrete, e.g. the setting behavior

Name: Terrazzo
Definition: Jointless cement screed made of colored natural stone grains and flours

Name: Schraubanker
Definition: Bolted anchoring in construction technology

Name: Surface vibrator
Definition: Surface vibrators in the form of vibratory screeds or vibratory plates are suitable for compacting moderately thick, horizontal or slightly inclined concrete fills from the surface. Compaction is achieved by vibrations transmitted by the mounted device. Surface vibrators are preferably used for compacting thinner flat components, e.g. roadways and slab-shaped precast elements in horizontal production. They can work freely on the concrete surface or be guided on gauges or rails during compaction.

Name: Graft
Definition: Enclosure ditch filled with water

Name: Tageslichtsystem
Definition: System for controlling solar radiation through vertical, translucent parts of the building envelope. Components include coated glass and slats.

Name: Blockstufe
Definition: Block step, solid step with rectangular cross-section, solid tread of a wooden staircase

Name: Bundwand
Definition: Wall construction with vertical timber studs, load-distributing horizontal framing and masonry infill

Name: constructive CLIC
Definition: Messeraumsystem

Name: Nozzle jet process
Definition: Dissolving the soil with a high-energy liquid jet and simultaneous mixing with cement

Name: Grafometer Geodetic instrument
Definition: Historical instrument for land surveying, forerunner of the theodolite

Name: Exterior construction
Definition: Used for the exterior of construction projects

Name: Federplatte
Definition: Plate (component) built using springs, also machine part

Name: Bodenleger
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Water cooling system
Definition: Cooling system with secondary circuit and the coolant water, in contrast to the direct cooling system

Name: Hochbauzeichner
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Condetti
Definition: Patented display method for details in timber construction, e.g. for training purposes or for work preparation

Name: Einhausung
Definition: Above-ground tunnel as noise protection

Name: Baudynamik
Definition: Effect of dynamic loads on components and structures

Name: Lintel Construction
Definition: Construction of the cover for a wall opening, door or window

Name: Building inspection tour
Definition: Tunnels, e.g. in dams

Name: Construction ring
Definition: Component in ring form

Name: Tree slice Road construction
Definition: Area around the trunk of trees to enable the necessary irrigation

Name: Binge
Definition: Superficial earth collapse due to collapse of mine workings

Name: Roller shutter and sun protection mechatronics technician
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Malerin und Lackiererin
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Bodenlegerin
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Berstverfahren
Definition: Method of pipe laying in tunnel construction

Name: Building and object coater
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Painter and varnisher, specializing in building and corrosion protection
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Pneumatic formwork
Definition: The outside consists of a hard formwork material, the inside of a flexible formwork material. A gas or liquid maintains the internal pressure and thus the shape of the soft inner shell during concreting and compaction.

Name: Reinforcement joint
Definition: Transition point between two reinforcing bars or meshes that meet

Name: Asphaltbinder
Definition: Mineral mixture bound with road bitumen for the binder course between the asphalt surface course and base course

Name: Gewerk
Definition: Trades are the work that can be assigned to a trade. The German Construction Contract Procedures (VOB) subdivide the trades in Part C and describe the respective general technical contract conditions for construction work

Name: Wellblech
Definition: corrugated sheet metal; the corrugation serves to stiffen in the transverse direction

Name: Wood and building preservationists
Definition: Recognized apprenticeship with 3-year training in the fields of building protection and wood preservation

Name: Holz- und Bautenschützerin
Definition: Anerkannter Ausbildungsberuf m. 3jähriger Ausbildung in d. Fachrichtungen Bautenschutz u. Holzschutz

Name: Specialist for wood and building protection work
Definition: Recognized occupation requiring 2 years of training

Name: Civil Engineering Prize from Wilhelm Ernst & Sohn
Definition: Biennial prize for engineering structures since 1988

Name: Workers in gardening and landscaping
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Romanzement
Definition: Historical building material, not cement in the modern sense

Name: Container building
Definition: Prefabricated room units that are assembled into buildings

Name: System 180
Definition: Modular tubular steel system for shelving, trusses, exhibition stand construction, etc

Name: Bodenvernagelung
Definition: Method for securing excavation pits and embankments. In soil nailing, the slope or excavation wall is sealed with shotcrete and nails (= tensile round rods) are inserted into holes and grouted.

Name: Walls
Definition: Lateral boundary of a portal or window cut diagonally into the wall surface, profiled or stepped; can be richly ornamented and fitted with archivolts and figures

Name: Building analysis
Definition: Technical analysis of a building

Name: Kreuzdach
Definition: Roof shape with cross gable that is raised up to the ridge

Name: Deep floor grouting
Definition: Agitators are used to mix the soil with binding agents at depth. The methods differ depending on the manufacturer.

Name: Bodenindikator
Definition: Tactile orientation aid in the floor area for the blind or visually impaired

Name: Blendfenster
Definition: Window that is placed in front of a closed wall, i.e. has no window opening behind it.

Name: Murus gallicus
Definition: Fortification wall, so-called Gallic wall, archaeologically proven wall construction technique of the Iron Age oppida, especially in Gaul; wooden frameworks made of stacked beams connected with large iron nails, in the gaps a stone-earth filling

Name: Pfostenschlitzmauer
Definition: Typical Celtic defensive walls of the late Iron Age, with vertical posts set into slit-like recesses in the wall face

Name: Mehrschienengleis
Definition: Track system with more than 2 rails, for driving on with different track gauges

Name: Inflatable supporting structure
Definition: Inflatable load-bearing building structure

Name: Fischabstiegsanlage
Definition: Facility designed to enable the downstream migration of fish (possibly bypassing power plants and trash racks).

Name: Carbonbeton
Definition: Carbon concrete consists of the two components concrete and a reinforcement made of carbon in the form of mats and rods.

Name: Noppenwabe
Definition: The dimpled honeycomb is a core material that is made from a textile impregnated with resin and has a three-dimensional dimpled structure. The properties of the material can be optimally adapted to the respective application by varying the textile used, the resin and the dimple geometry (dimple height, dimple diameter, dimple arrangement).

Name: Tied Foam Core
Definition: The sandwich core material is manufactured using a modified knotting process in which fiber bundles (rovings) consisting of untwisted (single) filaments are stitched through a foam in the desired pattern to produce a preform (a semi-finished fiber product). This so-called Tied Foam Core technology results in a lightweight material with superior damage tolerance, improved fatigue behavior and excellent mechanical flexibility compared to existing honeycomb structures commonly used in sandwich panels.

Name: Faltwabe
Definition: A wide variety of materials, such as thin metal, plastic or paper foil, are folded into a three-dimensional contour. These very rigid structures are used as the core material in sandwich components.

Name: Einfeldplatte
Definition: Tensioned reinforced concrete slab ceiling with one ceiling field

Name: Thingplatz
Definition: Refers to historical sites where popular and judicial assemblies were held according to ancient Germanic law. Also used for open-air theaters during the National Socialist era (Thing movement) and for urban or village squares (mainly in northern Germany)

Name: Caterpillar H63
Definition: Caterpillar hydraulic breaker, also in the H63s version

Name: Caterpillar H50
Definition: Caterpillar hydraulic breaker, also in the H50s version

Name: Caterpillar H45
Definition: Caterpillar hydraulic breaker, also in the H45 version

Name: Caterpillar H70
Definition: Hydraulic breaker from Caterpillar, also in the H70s version

Name: Hochbauzeichnerin
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Ulrich Finsterwalder Ingenieurbaupreis
Definition: Biennial prize for engineering structures

Name: Diamantquader
Definition: A special form of ashlar work developed in Italy around the middle of the 15th century, in which the house stone, usually made of marble, was worked into a facetted shape.

Name: Tabby building material
Definition: Tabby is a type of concrete made from burnt oyster shells (lime), water, sand, ash and broken oyster shells. Used from the 16th-19th century in the south of the USA for lack of other building materials.

Name: Opus caementicium
Definition: Ancient Roman masonry technique, mortar masonry, cast masonry made of lime mortar and stone chips or broken bricks

Name: Opus latericium
Definition: Ancient Roman masonry technique, clay brickwork

Name: Opus quadratum
Definition: Ancient Roman masonry technique, ashlar masonry

Name: Opus reticulatum
Definition: Ancient Roman wall surface cladding or wall bond technique; made of stones laid in mortar at right angles with smooth square outer surfaces to create a diamond or net pattern

Name: Opus mixtum
Definition: Ancient Roman mixed masonry, brick layers alternating with stone masonry, e.g. with opus incertum or opus reticulatum

Name: Opus romanum
Definition: Ancient Roman masonry, ashlar masonry

Name: Fin ray effect
Definition: Fish fins behave unexpectedly when lateral pressure is applied: For example, if you press lightly against the tail fin of a trout with your finger, it does not bend away in the direction of pressure as expected, but the fin moves against the direction of pressure towards your finger. This effect is known as the fin ray effect. The patented fin ray effect is based on the structure of the individual fin rays. These each consist of two fixed struts that converge at the tip and are firmly fused together there. The two struts form an acute-angled triangle. There are cross struts between the two flexible flanks, which keep the flanks at a distance and enable elastic movements. This reversal of function when lateral force is applied is the basis of many high-tech solutions.

Name: Fin ray finger

Name: Drahtbinder

Name: Exterior coating

Name: Nasspulvergießen

Name: Reaktionssintern
Definition: a form of sintering in which the partners to be sintered experience statunascendi states (state of new formation) during heating, react effectively with each other and sinter

Name: Orbital welding
Definition: Welding on circular track (pipes etc.)

Name: Aufschmelzverfahren

Name: Ersatzteilversorgung

Name: Brillantschliff

Name: Hartdrehen

Name: Axial-radial forming

Name: Revolverkopf

Name: Strahltechnologie

Name: Klappmesser

Name: Anschnitttechnik

Name: Stanznieten
Definition: Self-pierce riveting is a joining technology process that creates mechanical, high-strength joints between identical or dissimilar materials. Joints with more than two layers can also be realized.

Name: Putzerei
Definition: Operating department of a foundry in which the castings are freed from burrs, trimmings, sand, etc.

Name: Shock wave compaction
Definition: Compaction and consolidation of powders using shock waves

Name: Siebmacher

Name: Vollbohren

Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Melting saw
Definition: For sawing metal

Definition: Remote-controlled manipulator

Name: Trockenbearbeitung

Name: Hochleistungsplasmaspritzen
Definition: Process with higher electrical mains power and increased spray material throughput

Name: Beschicken
Definition: Materialzufuhr

Name: Feuerschlagmesser

Name: Metallbildner

Name: Farbwechseltechnik
Definition: Used for color change during painting. Consists of a color change block with pneumatically operated color valves for each color connection, as well as rinsing agent and air valves

Name: Process capability Quality management
Definition: A manufacturing process is process-capable if its consistent quality has been verified using statistical methods.

Name: Schleifschlamm
Definition: Chips from metalworking

Name: Soldering tube
Definition: right-angled metal tube with mouthpiece

Name: Tailored blank
Definition: Sheet metal of varying thickness and / or quality

Name: Inclined rolling process
Definition: Process for the production of seamless tubes

Name: Reactive plasma spraying
Definition: Plasma spraying process in which an in-situ synthesis of materials and simultaneous formation of layers by chemical reaction of solid or liquid starting materials takes place during the spraying process

Name: Rotationsschleifen
Definition: Surface grinding process with rotary workpiece movement

Name: Pneumomechanical deep drawing
Definition: Combined process consisting of an upstream forming process based on active media (e.g. using compressed air) and a subsequent deep-drawing process

Name: Sprengnieten
Definition: Riveting process in which an explosive charge placed in the rivet shank, ignited by heating or impact, produces the closing head

Name: Flow columns
Definition: A forming process similar to flow-forming, in which rotating, flat sheet metal blanks are partially split under the action of a special splitting tool.

Name: Schnittwert
Definition: The process-related cutting values are determined by the equipment used and the workpiece parameters (material characteristics, required surface quality, finished part geometry).

Name: Verkupferung
Definition: Benutzt für das Produkt

Name: Synchrondrehen
Definition: Workpiece surface is machined with two tools simultaneously and in kinematic coupling.

Name: Wirkmedium
Definition: Forming media are solid, liquid or gaseous substances that cause changes to the workpiece during the forming process using various forms of energy

Name: Mehrfachdrahtziehen
Definition: s. M under Wire drawing machine

Name: Spund
Definition: Wooden peg, peg, plug for closing barrels and other containers

Name: Dengeln
Definition: Sharpen scythes or sickles by thinning the cutting edge

Name: Bördeleisen
Definition: Tool used in metalworking to raise a narrow edge, e.g. on sheet metal parts or pipes, for stiffening or joining (joining). Carried out manually using a flanging iron and hammer

Name: Schmiedewerkzeug
Definition: Tools used in the pressure forming of metal.

Name: Assembly line
Definition: Conveyor used in series production for material transportation. (flow production); the conveyor belt is also used to transport bulk goods over long distances

Name: Knauf
Definition: Handle part for cutting and stabbing weapons, vessel lids, element of the switch for electrical appliances, etc.

Name: Metall- und Glockengießer
Definition: New training occupation since 1998, which combines the occupations of bell founder, pewter caster, metal former and metal caster with the specializations "pewter casting technology, art and bell casting" and "metal casting technology"

Name: Georg Schlesinger Prize
Definition: Prize in the field of production technology, donated by the Berlin Senate in 1979, first awarded in 1980, then every 3 years.

Name: Eisenblech
Definition: Iron rolled into sheet metal

Name: Kreiskeil
Definition: Non-circular profile for detachable shaft-hub connections and pin-hole fastenings

Name: Heften
Definition: (Loose) fastening with needles, threads etc.

Name: Stativ
Definition: Frame for attaching cameras, telescopes and other devices.

Name: Parallelroboter
Definition: Industrial robots with parallel-structured drives

Name: Sägemaschine
Definition: Sawing machine

Name: Schaber
Definition: Tool for removing fine chips or layers

Name: Streudose

Name: Werkzeugschrank
Definition: Cabinet (often made of metal) in which tools are stored.

Name: Grammophonnadeldose
Definition: Container for storing gramophone needles

Name: Free lengths
Definition: Drawing tool is replaced by an induction heater with subsequent cooling device

Name: Feilkloben
Definition: Hand vice for clamping small workpieces

Name: Mallet tool
Definition: Miner's hammer

Name: Bore pressures
Definition: Cold forging process; combination process of cup-back extrusion and stretch forming

Name: Laser transmission welding
Definition: Special form of laser welding. A laser beam penetrates a plastic that is transparent to this laser light and heats an absorbent plastic until it melts.

Name: Cementation Metallurgy
Definition: Process for surface treatment of metals, e.g. for case hardening

Name: Polymechaniker
Definition: Apprenticeship (Switzerland)

Name: Raspel
Definition: Coarse file shape; also kitchen utensil for chopping

Name: Machine and plant operator
Definition: Two-year apprenticeship

Name: Steinbohrer
Definition: Drill suitable for working on stone, concrete, etc.

Name: Kabelkonfektionierung
Definition: Manufacture of ready-to-install cables, with insulation, plug and suitable length

Name: Oberflächenbeschichter
Definition: From 1.8.2005 new training occupation; continuation of electroplater with modified training

Name: Glockengießerin
Definition: Seit 1998 mit den Ausbildungsberufen "Zinngießer" und "Metallformer und Metallgießer" zum neuen Handwerksberuf "Metall- und Glockengießer" zusammengefasst

Name: Dreher
Definition: Job title until 1987

Name: Sonotrode
Definition: Sonotrode: Mechanical component that transmits the ultrasonic vibrations generated by the transducer to the material to be sonicated.

Name: Model maker Demonstration model making
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf in Nordrhein-Westfalen

Name: Model maker Production model making
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf in Nordrhein-Westfalen

Name: Incremental forming
Definition: Forming process which is essentially characterized by the fact that regions of the workpiece undergo more than one loading/unloading cycle within one production step.

Name: Kreuzbohrung
Definition: Holes that cut or penetrate cross holes already drilled in the component as well as pre-cast channels.

Name: Produktionstechnologe
Definition: New training occupation since 1.8.2008

Name: Drahtflammspritzen
Definition: A rod- or wire-shaped coating material is heated with the aid of a fuel gas-oxygen flame and sprayed onto a base material at high speed with the addition of compressed air

Name: Laserstrahlbiegen
Definition: Bending a workpiece with laser light.

Name: Kettenschmied
Definition: Blacksmith specializing in the forging of iron link chains

Name: Cold wire welding
Definition: Arc welding process in which a cold or preheated welding wire is melted without current in the arc of a wire electrode.

Name: Awl tool
Definition: Needle-like tool for pre-piercing or expanding holes, e.g. in leather

Name: Beitel
Definition: Chisels are tools for machining wood.

Name: Dechsel
Definition: An axe-like tool for cutting out hollows or similar with a slightly curved blade at right angles to the handle.

Name: Technical model maker
Definition: Apprenticeship occupation from August 1, 2009, resulting from training as a model maker and model making mechanic

Name: Technische Modellbauerin
Definition: Apprenticeship occupation from August 1, 2009, resulting from training as a model maker and model making mechanic

Name: Rotglut
Definition: Heat treatment of metals; annealing color that occurs when solid materials are heated: Incipient red heat at 525 C, dark red 700 C, cherry red 800 C, light red 900 C, salmon red 1000 C.

Name: Metallwerkzeug
Definition: Tool made of metal

Name: Orbitalbohren
Definition: In orbital machining, the milling tool spirals into the workpiece on a helical path (satellite or orbital movement) to create the hole.

Name: Ziehbank
Definition: Apparatus for wire production

Name: Modelleur
Definition: Skilled worker or (art) craftsman who designs models.

Name: Stippling plate coin technique
Definition: Clay plate with trough-shaped indentations for melting the raw material for coins

Name: Onsert connecting element
Definition: Connecting element for point load application, consisting of a functional element and a flat plate element, which is bonded to the substrate.

Name: Linear friction welding
Definition: With linear friction welding, the entire surface is heated by friction, in contrast to rotary friction welding.

Name: Radial friction welding
Definition: Belongs to the group of pressure welding processes. One of two parts to be welded must be rotationally symmetrical

Name: Orbital friction welding
Definition: In contrast to the related rotational friction welding process, the parts do not have to be rotationally symmetrical.

Name: Roll-bond process
Definition: Two sheets are joined together by rolling at high pressure.

Name: Spot-weld bonding
Definition: Belongs to the hybrid joining processes and represents the combination of structural bonding with the spot welding joining process.

Name: Electrofusion welding
Definition: Used to join plastic pipes made of semi-crystalline thermoplastic.

Name: Blindnietkleben
Definition: Belongs to the hybrid joining processes and represents the combination of blind riveting with gluing.

Name: Laser-MSG hybrid welding
Definition: Laser-MSG hybrid welding is a welding process in which laser beam welding is combined with a gas metal arc welding process (MIG/MAG).

Name: Hybridschweißen
Definition: Hybrid welding combines laser welding with other welding processes.

Name: Welding rivets
Definition: Used to join a component made of plastic or non-ferrous metal to a component made of steel, non-ferrous metal or plastic and a composite component produced thereafter by riveting and welding. (Patent number DE 102010034183 A1)

Name: Slicermesser
Definition: Slicer knives are circular slicing knives for cutting food products.

Name: Nassschleifen
Definition: Sanding with the addition of a liquid abrasive.

Name: Engineering asset management
Definition: Is an emerging inter-disciplinary field that combines the technical issues of asset reliability, safety and performance with financial and managerial skills.

Name: Folienvaporisation
Definition: Pulse forming technology; production of metallic workpieces by rapid vaporization of metallic foils using very high pulsed electrical currents

Name: Modelleurin
Definition: Skilled worker or (art) craftswoman who designs models

Name: Bin Picking
Definition: Bin picking is the automated handling of randomly arranged parts in the production process, e.g. separation from a pallet cage or crate and feeding or loading of the downstream machine, e.g. using industrial robots as feeding devices.

Name: Reibnieten
Definition: Friction riveting is a new spot joining process based on both mechanical joining (positive and non-positive locking) and friction welding technology. The joining partners (base materials) are connected with the aid of a metallic stud. Thermoplastic and metallic materials can be used as base materials in various combinations.

Name: R2R method
Definition: In the manufacture of flexible printed electronics, R2R is a way of producing flexible electronic components, printed on a web of flexible plastic or metal foil, quickly and cost-effectively. Other areas of application for the R2R process are in the field of coating and normal printing on substrates. For this purpose, the starting material on a roll is unrolled, processed and then rolled up again.

Name: Verbundschmieden
Definition: Composite forging is the form- and material-locking joining of at least two different materials with simultaneous form-fitting shaping.

Name: Infrared welding
Definition: Welding using infrared technology in plastic joining technology

Name: Hook wrench
Definition: Tool for tightening and loosening special fasteners, e.g. round/groove nuts or covers

Name: Knickbauchen
Definition: Buckling is a tensile pressure forming process according to DIN 8584, in which elongated hollow bodies of low wall thickness are widened or constricted on their tangential circumference in the form of a convex (bulging) or concave (necking) belly shape by compressive forces applied along the longitudinal axis.

Name: Hot roll bonding
Definition: Two sheets are joined together by rolling under heat and high pressure.

Name: Halbhohlstanznieten
Definition: This process is punch riveting with a semi-tubular punch rivet.

Name: Tailored tubes
Definition: These are tubular components in car bodies that are joined together by laser welding and placed in a die, then filled with liquids and subsequently pressed against the shape of the die at an internal pressure of several hundred megapascals (hydroforming).

Name: Bolzensetzen
Definition: Joining by means of bolts driven in by explosive force, referred to in DIN 8593-3 as bolt setting

Name: Schleifbrand
Definition: Grinding burn is thermal damage to the material. Grinding burn occurs during the grinding of the workpieces.

Name: Net shape forming
Definition: In net shape forming, the component is manufactured close to the final dimensions by forming. The end product has the specified dimensions without machining.

Name: Rapid Tooling
Definition: The term rapid tooling describes a field of application of generative or additive manufacturing processes for the production of tools or tool components in toolmaking or mold making, in particular plastic injection molds.

Name: Zinkphosphatierung
Definition: Zinc phosphating in accordance with EN12476 is a chemical surface treatment for steel. A zinc phosphate layer of 1 to 3 micrometers is formed on the material surface. The layer is absorbent and firmly bonded to the base metal.

Name: Z-Pinning
Definition: Z-pinning is a joining technique for mostly bonded fiber composites (prepregs) in the Z-direction. Z-pins or Z-fibers are used to support the joint strength in the Z-direction.  Z-pins have a similar shape to pins and are made of metal or fiber composite material.

Name: Z-Pin
Definition: Z-pins or Z-fibres are used to support the joining strength of mostly bonded fiber composites (prepregs) in the Z-direction.  Z-pins have a similar shape to pins and are made of metal or fiber composite material.

Name: Preforming
Definition: Preforming refers to processes for the production of a near-net-shape, dry reinforcement structure, starting with the semi-finished product cutting, draping to the final contour with connection of the individual layers and final trimming with any intermediate handling steps for the production of fiber-reinforced components, primarily in the liquid impregnation process.

Name: Nasswickelverfahren
Definition: In the wet winding process, the carbon fibers are impregnated with thermosetting epoxy resin, wound onto a core and the resin is cured in an oven.

Name: Friction-based Injection Clinching Joining
Definition: F-ICJ is a riveting process with a plastic rivet (pin). In F-ICL, a metallic tool is used to apply frictional energy and pressure to the plastic pin and deform it into a rivet. Recesses in the joining partner absorb the softened plastic, resulting in stable countersunk rivets. The joining partners can be thermoplastic and metallic materials in various combinations.

Name: Flycutting
Definition: Milling is a chip-removing process in which the tool cutting edge performs the main cutting movement. The milling tool rotates and removes a chip with a cutting edge on its face or on its circumferential surface. If the movement of the cutting edge is on a large radius, this is referred to as flycutting. If the flycutting tool is mounted radially, linear structures, e.g. diffraction gratings, can be produced easily. If the flycutting tool is positioned on the end face, very large surfaces with particularly low roughness (Ra = 2 to 10 nm) can be produced, e.g. mirrors.

Name: Nadler
Definition: Historical profession; manufacture of and trade in needles of all kinds, later also buttons in some cases

Name: Knopfmacher
Definition: Historical profession; buttons were made from numerous materials by craftsmen from different trades

Name: Drahtstickerei
Definition: technology to produce homogeneous heating elements with high-temperature resistant yarns.

Name: Trockenschleifen
Definition: Sanding without the addition of a liquid abrasive.

Name: Direct Energy Deposition
Alternate Name: Material application with directed energy input
Definition: Refers to several similar metal 3D printing technologies that produce components by melting and fusing material.

Name: Zieheisen
Definition: Device on the drawing bench with holes of different sizes through which metal is drawn into wire.

Name: Manual arc welding
Definition: Manual variant of arc welding, which is part of fusion welding.

Name: Dietrich tool
Definition: Hook-like curved tool for opening locks

Name: Wire Deposition
Alternate Name: Material application by means of directed energy input using thermal energy and wire
Definition: In these processes, a metal wire is melted in a gas atmosphere or vacuum using a laser beam, electron beam or plasma arc to generate a component layer.

Name: Turmuhr
Definition: The monumental clocks housed in towers, churches, town halls and other public buildings, also known as display clocks.

Name: Wheel clock
Definition: A wheel clock is a mechanical clock with a movement made up of gears.

Name: Beobachtungsuhr
Definition: Mostly pocket watches for observation f. Military, research, aviation and seafaring

Name: Augenoptiker
Definition: Training occupation or, according to Molle, a skilled trade

Name: Gravieren
Definition: used for introductions to the artistic technique

Name: Enigma cipher machine
Definition: Developed for the Reichswehr and Wehrmacht as early as 1931

Name: Mechatronik
Definition: Interdisciplinary field of engineering science Mechanical-Electrical Engineering-Computer Science

Name: Grande Complication
Definition: The only wristwatch that is also a repeater watch

Name: LIGA procedure
Definition: Deep X-ray lithography with synchrotron radiation and subsequent electroforming

Name: Regulator watch
Definition: Pendulum clock with adjustable weight

Name: Reverso
Definition: Armbanduhr

Name: Punktbild
Definition: The point image of an optical system is the intensity distribution in the image plane when a point-shaped object is imaged.

Name: Reiseuhr
Definition: Clocks manufactured from the mid-16th century onwards

Name: Makroobjektiv
Definition: Special lens for close-ups

Name: Schiffschronometer
Definition: Mechanical, particularly accurate clock for navigation purposes

Name: Longines
Definition: Markenname

Name: Jahresuhr
Definition: Mechanical table clock with a running time of at least one year, technically designed as a torsion pendulum clock

Name: Hearing aid acoustician
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf

Name: Gear clock
Definition: A quantity that indicates how much a watch runs ahead or behind in a certain time. Here extended to the accuracy of watches in general.

Name: Tangente wristwatch
Definition: Product name of a wristwatch made by Nomos in Glashütte, Saxony

Name: Blankpressen
Definition: Hot forming of ready-to-use optical surfaces in a single work step

Name: Kontrolluhr
Definition: Time recording devices for monitoring working, parking and driving times, etc.

Name: Stackfreed
Definition: Spring brake to compensate for the decreasing spring tension when the movement runs down

Name: Skelettuhr
Definition: Clock with openworked dial and case, except for supporting parts, to reveal the movement

Name: Burgundy watch
Definition: Large clock with weight drive manufactured in the French Jura from ca. 1680-1915

Name: Guillochieren
Definition: Production of fine, intricate line drawings in steel engraving style on metal, securities, to make forgery more difficult

Name: Quadrant
Definition: Histor. Instrument used in astronomy and nautical science to determine the altitude of a celestial body

Name: Harfenuhr
Definition: Large clock with musical movement

Name: LUER connection
Definition: Conical connector for medical devices

Name: Fast Tool Servo System
Definition: Term adopted from English; describes an additional machine component for the highly dynamic movement of the tool in the infeed direction during turning

Name: Star Caliber 2000
Definition: Luxury pocket watch with 21 functions.

Name: Escapement technology
Definition: Device in mechanical watches that causes the hand movement to run synchronously with the oscillating system

Name: Halsuhr
Definition: These are small box- or ball-shaped watches that were attached to a ribbon or chain and hung around the neck.

Name: Adressiermaschine
Definition: Semi-automatic or fully automatic device that reproduces recurring address material in print; abbreviation

Name: Zeitmesser
Definition: Device for measuring and displaying the time

Name: Kaminuhr
Definition: Clock used to decorate the mantelpiece

Name: Stutzuhr
Definition: Clock with spring drive and balance, whose case is considerably lower than that of the floor clock and therefore appears "truncated".

Name: Vervielfältigungsapparat
Definition: Apparatus by which something (written, printed or similar) is reproduced.

Name: Kurzzeitschaltuhr
Definition: Simple timer in the sense of an exposure timer, staircase lighting

Name: Lupe
Definition: Magnifying glass, collecting lens system with short focal length for magnifying observation of small objects.

Name: Programmschaltuhr
Definition: To control a program timed by the clock (e.g. machine control, washing machine, street lighting).

Name: Schaltuhr
Definition: Clock in conjunction with switches that trigger functions by making electrical, and in the past also mechanical, contacts.

Name: Doorbell
Definition: Mechanical signaling device that is operated on the outside of the front door. The modern term is doorbell and takes into account the electrical function of the signaling device.

Name: Türklingel
Definition: Electrical signaling device that is operated on the outside of the front door. The outdated term is doorbell and takes into account the mechanical function of the signaling device.

Name: Typenhebelmaschine
Definition: Typewriter in which the type lever with the type is moved to the platen when a key is pressed. A ribbon guided between the paper and the type ensures a high-contrast imprint of the letter or character.

Name: Geologenkompass
Definition: Special compass for measuring the strike and dip of geolog. The compass is equipped with a 360° graduation or 400-gon graduation, clinometer, level and sighting device. The designations for east (E) and west (W) are reversed.

Name: Uhrwerk
Definition: Movement (in the sense of drive) of a watch

Name: Zeigerschreibmaschine
Definition: Typewriter that is operated via an interchangeable letter field and a guide pen instead of a keyboard.

Name: ATMOS
Definition: Jaeger-leCoultre pendulum clock driven by fluctuations in air pressure or temperature.

Name: Trompeteruhr
Definition: Special Black Forest figurine clock with trumpet signal

Name: Gewichtsuhr
Definition: Collective reference for wall and grandfather clocks with weight drive

Name: Federzugsuhr
Definition: Clocks with spiral curved spring as drive

Name: Jacob's staff Nautical instrument
Definition: Medieval protractor. Protractor for determining the height of the stars, replaced by the sextant

Name: Frisian clock
Definition: Chair clock from Friesland with pendulum and weights hanging on chains with special links. The F. U. was made in the 18th and 19th centuries. The metal dials are richly painted with arabesques, figures and mermaids (Seewiefkes) and decorated with pewter ornaments. There are also indications of the calendar and the phases of the moon. A decorated cloth over the dial can conceal the time.

Name: Orpheus clock
Definition: Renaissance table clock type

Name: Stuhluhr
Definition: Type of clock from the 17th and 18th centuries, in which a clockwork supported by four pillars stands on a wall console like a small chair

Name: Royal Oak wristwatch
Definition: Product name of a wristwatch from Audemars Piguet

Name: Rolex brand
Definition: Markenname

Name: Mikrofluidik
Definition: Microfluidics deals with the behavior of liquids and gases in the smallest of spaces, the micrometer range.

Name: Mignon typewriter
Definition: Pointer typewriter d. Company AEG, built 1904-1932

Name: Equation clock
Definition: Clock showing the difference between mean and true solar time

Name: Submariner wristwatch
Definition: Product name of a diver's wristwatch developed in 1952 and produced since 1953

Name: Pneumatic clock
Definition: Central clock with pneumatically controlled connected clocks, invented in 1880

Name: Augenoptikerin
Definition: Ausbildungsberuf bzw. nach Molle ein Handwerksberuf

Name: Elementaruhr
Definition: An elementary clock includes all timepieces that are controlled by natural elements.

Name: Kanzeluhr
Definition: Hourglass attached to church pulpits to control the preacher's speaking time.

Name: Feueruhr
Definition: Timer based on the principle of uniform burning of flammable substances, which can also be scented.

Name: Oil watch
Definition: An oil lamp used in the Middle Ages and into the Baroque period, whose falling oil level indicated on a scale on the glass oil container how much time had passed since the lamp was lit.

Name: Schwingpendeluhr
Definition: A clock that swings back and forth as a pendulum. Its pivot point is located below the dial.

Name: Schwerkraftuhr
Definition: General term for all clocks that are driven by their own weight or the effect of gravity.

Name: Hanging clock
Definition: Spherical clock suspended on a cord or chain that unwinds from a spring drum inside, with a dial mounted horizontally in the base or a dial ring that moves around the circumference of the sphere past a fixed hand.

Name: Kugellaufuhr
Definition: A mechanical clock in which a ball rolling on an inclined plane acts as a rate regulator.

Name: Saw watch
Definition: A playful version of the gravity clock, in which the clock body is driven by its own weight as it slides down a rack.

Name: Anhängeruhr
Definition: A watch worn visibly on a chain around the neck or a châtelaine on the belt.

Name: Bisamapfeluhr
Definition: The first portable wheel clocks were sometimes built into muskmelons (smelling boxes that were worn on a chain around the neck or on the wrist).

Name: Dosenuhr
Definition: Early form of small portable clock modeled on the drum-shaped table clocks.

Name: Fantasieformuhr
Definition: Generic term for pendant clocks of the 17th and 18th centuries, whose cases are artistically designed in unusual shapes independent of their function, such as animals, musical instruments, flowers, etc.

Name: Totenkopfuhr
Definition: A fantasy clock from the 16th and 17th centuries in which a clockwork is built into a metal or ivory skull; when the brain shell or lower jaw is opened, the clock face can be seen.

Name: Blindenuhr
Definition: A pocket watch with raised number symbols and strong hands without glazing above the dial, where the time can be felt by the blind.

Name: Revolutionsuhr
Definition: Designation for pocket watches with decimal division, which was introduced in France in 1792 during the French Revolution as a replacement for the duodecimal division, but which, together with decimal time, did not catch on and was abolished again in 1795.

Name: Druckuhr
Definition: Pocket watch that appeared in the middle of the 19th century, in which the mainspring is tensioned by moving a rack or a chain with a knob up and down.

Name: Eisenbahneruhr
Definition: Oversized service pocket watch with a robust metal case and a high-quality lever movement, which was once used by the train driver to ensure precise adherence to the timetable.

Name: Emailuhr
Definition: Term for pocket watches whose metal case and often also dials are completely covered with enamel painting.

Name: Goldemailuhr
Definition: Gold enamel watches are watches with gold cases and enamel overlays, often based on designs by well-known artists.

Name: Offiziersuhr
Definition: Technically accomplished and decorative travel clocks from the 18th and early 19th century, usually with a brass case, striking mechanism and repeater, often also with quarter-hour strike and alarm movement.

Name: Roskopfuhr
Definition: A large, cheap pocket watch from the end of the 19th century. These pocket watches had a very simplified gear train in which all superfluous parts were eliminated.

Name: Sackuhr
Definition: A pocket watch that you always wear inside your clothes (while pocket watches can also be worn open).

Name: Oignon watch
Definition: A French pocket watch of the 17th and early 18th century. Originally used as a derisive, derogatory term for large, clumsy and particularly thick pocket watches.

Name: Savonette
Definition: Pocket watch with spring cover to protect the glazed dial, which pops open at the touch of a button.

Name: Halbsavonette
Definition: A pocket watch with a spring lid, in the middle of which there is a circular glazed opening so that the time can be read even when the lid is closed.

Name: Souscription watch
Definition: Single-handed pocket watches with hour and five-minute graduations. Made by Abraham Louis Breguet around 1800 to special order and for a deposit (souscription).

Name: Kurzzeitwecker
Definition: A short-time alarm clock, nowadays also known colloquially as an "egg timer" or signal clock, is a backward-running alarm clock that emits an acoustic, visual or mechanical signal after a preset period of time - typically up to 120 minutes.

Name: Eieruhr
Definition: An egg timer was originally an hourglass filled with finely grated egg shells instead of grains of sand. Later, the term was used colloquially for a short-time alarm clock.

Name: Radiowecker
Definition: Combination of clock and radio receiver

Name: Hauptuhr
Definition: A master clock is the time standard of a centrally controlled modern clock system.

Name: Monumentaluhr
Definition: Huge mechanical clocks that are usually integrated into buildings.

Name: Altaruhr
Definition: An altar clock is a period clock with an altar-like wooden case, the front of which is modeled on baroque altars with columns and a sprung pediment, sometimes even with a painted altar leaf.

Name: Nachtlampenuhr
Definition: Table clocks of different shapes and designs, which can also be used to tell the time in the dark.

Name: Portaluhr
Definition: A type of clock in which two or more pillars form a kind of portal and support the movement, which is built into the superstructure.

Name: Religieuse clock
Definition: Simple French pendulum with a crowning arch that makes the case look like a church portal.

Name: Turret clock
Definition: This type of clock was modeled on a Renaissance clock tower and often had dials with different indications on all four sides.

Name: Vasenuhr
Definition: A pendulum in the shape of a vase or urn.

Name: Globusuhr
Definition: A spherical pendant or figurine clock depicting the globe, with a fixed hand and moving dial.

Name: Doppelpendeluhr
Definition: Pendulum clock with two identical pendulums suspended from a common gallows and usually also two movements and dials.

Name: Monstranzuhr
Definition: The monstrance clock is the name given to a type of Renaissance clock from the 17th century for which clockworks were built into monstrance-shaped table clocks. Monstrance clocks were also known as mirror clocks and have a religious and symbolic character.

Name: Mysterieuse
Definition: A table clock in which you cannot see how the hands work together with the movement due to the use of mirrors or other illusionary effects.

Name: Buchuhr
Definition: A popular clock in the form of a book in the 16th and 17th centuries. The clock face is located under the hinged cover.

Name: Carteluhr
Definition: French version of a wall clock, particularly popular in the Rococo period, in an ornate, richly decorated and asymmetrical cast bronze frame.

Name: Dachluhr
Definition: Special shape of an elongated Austrian wall clock with a roof finial, usually with high-quality movements.

Name: Freimaureruhr
Definition: Pocket watch or wristwatch for members of the Masonic Lodge. These watches are usually triangular and bear masonic symbols (square, compass, hammer, trowel, plumb line, spirit level) on the dial and case.

Name: Konsolenuhr
Definition: A console clock is a clock or pendulum standing on a wall console.

Name: Cantilever clock
Definition: A clock that is constructed in such a way that it practically represents its own pendulum. The movement body hangs on a spring suspension and a pendulum rod, it swings back and forth relatively slowly and thus creates its own time standard.

Name: Laternenuhr
Definition: A prismatic, small, usually open metal hourglass with a weight drive in the shape of a lantern and initially designed as a wall clock on a wall bracket.

Name: Rahmenuhr
Definition: Term for clocks that are inserted into a picture frame as a wall clock and thus function as a picture themselves. A special form would be the picture clock

Name: Bilderuhr
Definition: From around 1780, it became fashionable to incorporate clock, striking and musical mechanisms into oil paintings. In the picture, a small clock face - usually on a painted tower - shows the time.

Name: Laterndluhr
Definition: Type of Viennese wall clock from the Biedermeier period in a slender, simple wooden case with a glazed front, the box top of which resembles a lantern.

Name: Surrer
Definition: A simple but ingenious Black Forest clock. The whole wheel has to turn with each strike, so that you can hear the intense whirring of the wheel when the hour strikes.

Name: Ringuhr
Definition: A watch housed in a finger ring instead of a coat of arms stone.

Name: Telleruhr
Definition: Plate clocks are wall clocks and owe their name to the dial, which resembles a plate or a plate.

Name: Tower clock
Definition: Simple weighted clock with alarm mechanism and hour strike, which was hung in the doorman's room and gave the doorman the time to strike the tower bell.

Name: Zappler
Definition: General term for grandfather clocks and wall clocks with a short, false pendulum (front pendulum) swinging in front of the dial.

Name: Tischzappler
Definition: A spring-driven verge clock with a short front pendulum that is placed on the table.

Name: Erotic watch
Definition: Usually a pocket watch with a painted erotic image or an erotic automaton, i.e. with moving figures, which is usually hidden in the watch case.

Name: Kutschenuhr
Definition: This type of travel clock, usually in the form of a large pocket watch, was generally housed in a leather case with sound holes and was attached either in the carriage or to the saddle to serve as a timepiece on the journey.

Name: Schreibkugel
Definition: First mass-produced typewriter in the world, developed by Hans Rasmus Johan[n] Malling Hansen in 1867
